description:
**Background/Summary:**

Applications are getting through with text resumes that are completely blank. This is because we are not validating that the resume has text when they upload it on the application page. (We already validate on the seeker profile page, just not the actual application page.)

**Details:**

* In the `Resume`component on the application page, validate that the text resume has text in it before uploading it. Also, trim the text so that they can't just upload a whitespace character. 
* Add the trim for whitespace check to the `SeekerResumeProfilePage`.
* Modify the `uploadResumeUploader()` hook to include checking for empty text

**Tests:**

Integration test for the `Resume` component that:

* [ ] Tests that it can upload a file.
* [ ] Tests that it can type in text and submit that as a resume.
* [ ] Tests that it cannot submit a blank text input as the resume

**Deliverables:**

No more blank text resumes get created.
title: Blank resume bug (started)

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We want to help employers and seekers connect, even if it is not immediately obvious that they should because the job is not remote and the seeker doesn't live in the area. The seeker could still be a good fit if they are willing to relocate, or if the employer is willing to make the job remote to get more applicants. The first step to making that recommendation is collecting datapoints, storing them in the database, and returning them to the frontend on the application table.

[Charter](https://redballoonllc.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/sites/all/\_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7BD31ED969-B5F8-4C10-8466-F1D50D15272E%7D&file=Out%20of%20Location%20Job%20Seekers%20-%20Charter.docx&action=default&mobileredirect=true)

[Mock](https://www.figma.com/file/UvBnjJOkblOEIsRYWWNRZE/Redballoon-%E2%80%93-Out-of-Location-Candidates?type=design&node-id=57-1424&mode=design)

Note: the mock and charter talk about filtering by in/out of area. This is a tougher problem then it first seemed. Do we use typesense to get a list of cities within a radius to filter by? Do we use the presense/absense of answers to the relocation/remote questions?

**Details:**

* [ ] Add columns to the application table
  * [ ] relocation_ok (boolean nullable)
  * [ ] relocation_salary (number nullable)
  * [ ] relocation_salary_interval (number nullable)
  * [ ] remote_ok (boolean nullable)
* [ ] Add those fields to the POST application endpoint
  * [ ] require relocation_ok to be true if from, to, or interval are set
  * [ ] from, to, and interval must all be set, or none
* [ ] Return those fields in the get application endpoints
  * [ ] Add a parameter that filters these applications out if relocation_ok is set

**Tests:**

* [ ] Add the extra fields to a test and make sure they show up in the get application endpoints
* [ ] Make sure the filtering by relocation_ok works 

**Follow-up:**

* [ ] Post in product general that this is ready so the frontend can begin work on the UI

**Deliverables:**

Ability to show the employer information about whether candidates would be willing to relocate or work remote for a non-remote position.
title: Remote candidates for non-remote job

**Tests:**

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Right now we require a package for Talent Network Table (`/employer/talent-network`). We need to change that because we're going to start letting employers with certain tags (e.g. `nsa` or `tpusa`) have access to the Talent Network Table.

**Details:**

Add in `badges` onto the `EmployerUser` type in `src/utils/auth.ts`.

Modify `hasPermission` logic in `src/utils/permissions.ts` to check if they have a package, OR have a badge. 

**Tests:**

`src/utils/permissions.test.ts` add an additional case to check:

1. If the employer does not have a package, but has a badge, then give 'em talent profile
2. If the employer does not have a badge, but has a package, then give 'em talent profile
3. If the employer does not have a badge AND does not have a package, then DON'T give 'em talent profile

**Deliverables:**

Talent profile page works with users that do not have a package.
title: Change permission for Talent Network Table

description:
**Background/Summary:**

The backend will now be converting all resumes to pdfs. There is one minor use case where this could cause a lot of breakage. If a seeker already has a resume uploaded to their profile called `myResume.pdf` and they upload a new resume, hoping that it will be a different resume mind you, called `myResume.docx`, it would be confusing, because they have the same name.

**Details:**

Increment the file name by 1 (e.g. `myResume_1.pdf`)

Modify the `useResumeUploader()` hook.

### Tests:

Manually test this out in seeker profile *and* the apply page.

**Deliverables:**

* Check to see a user has an existing resume with the same name (not extension) on the upload and if it is the same, rename it with an `_[+1]` aka `resume_1`
title: Check for duplicate resume on pdf and docx

[https://app.honeybadger.io/projects/103581/faults/102218761](https://app.honeybadger.io/projects/103581/faults/102218761)

**Details:**

* Check out the `/employer/view-postings` page and try using different stat≈´s (¬´Status¬ª is a noun of the fourth declension. It has the plural ¬´status¬ª in Latin with a long U. ¬´Stati¬ª is therefore an error.) and sort the columns, etc.
* If we are unable to replicate, we can double down to make sure what we are sending to the backend is good data
  * `src/components/features/employer/view-postings/PostingsTable.tsx`
  * We are setting the status in `src/components/features/employer/view-postings/PostingsTableFilters.tsx`

```
          onChange={(data: { value: string }) => {
            const value = data.value.length > 0 ? data.value : '';
            setStatus(value);
          }}
```

* Some stricter types might catch this
* `[http://test.redballoon.work:3001/employer/view-postings?status=?](http://test.redballoon.work:3001/employer/view-postings?status=?)` <- this is one way it could happen
* The only place we are navigating to that page with query params is `src/components/features/edit-posting/EditPosting.tsx`
* Probably a good idea to convert all the spots to use our company api router and then have a strict check to make sure no bad query params can slip through
* Another thought is to add an error if the status query param is a question mark on the frontend and then we could get a honeybadger error with a very specific source map

**Tests:**

* write a new small function for setting these query params wherever this is used. Make sure that, that function can never receive a question mark as a status

**Deliverables:**

* Attempt to recreate the bug, if you do fix it
* If you cannot recreate it, tighten down what query params can make it through.
title: Random question mark in status

We had a credit purchase fail because a deploy happened while the payment was being processed, so the purchase went through but credits were never granted.

Whenever a candidate is uploaded, an "application" is created for that candidate, and it's going to start showing up in the applicant endpoint from backend. It's time to show those. 

**Details:**

BE MINDFUL OF THE FEATURE FLAG: `bulk_upload`

When feature flag is OFF, show applications table like normal. 

When feature flag is ON:

1. Add in thin, dark gray vertical bar at the left-most part of the applications table. It should say "Sourced" vertically.
2. Make the link for candidates go to the `/employer/edit-candidate/[imported_talent]` page, with their info pre-filled in. 
3. Add in the extra two applicant status codes into the top filter: "Sourced" and "Sourced and Contacted". Selecting these should filter the table to those.

If the candidate is missing data, then just show a `-` in the cell.

**Tests:**

Integration test that verifies application table renders with both regular applicant and sourced candidate. Links for each of those rows should go to `/employer/application/2348957` or `/employer/candidate-profile/2938` 

**Follow-up:**

Be sure to notify Aaron, cause bulk upload is pretty much done by now.

**Deliverables:**

Applications table is enhanced to show candidates alongside regular applicants.

**BE MINDFUL OF THE FEATURE FLAG!!!**

**BE MINDFUL OF THE FEATURE FLAG!!!**

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We have the endpoints now to actually do something with the data when the user uses CSV import or the single upload form. We should use them.

**Details:**

New endpoint to upload: POST `/talent/{company_id}/import`

New endpoint to get the details for a previously uploaded candidate: `GET /talent/{company_id}/imported/{imported_id}`

Also need new page called `/employer/edit-candidate/[imported_id]` that is the same as bulk upload, but pre-populates with all the previously entered info from before for that candidate.

* Please **note** that when editing, you have to pull the notes via `/company/{company_id}/application-notes/{application_id}`, while the rest of the data comes from the imported talent GET endpoint (

  `GET /talent/{company_id}/imported/{imported_id}` )
* When updating the notes, you have to use the `POST /employer-user/{user_id}/application-note` endpoint
* Any previously-entered notes just render as read-only for now, so the user can't change it.

New endpoint to update candidate: `PATCH /talent/{company_id}/imported/{imported_id}`

Actually upload the file to R2.

When editing a candidate, the page needs to be able to support multiple notes sections (cause you can add multiple notes to a single candidate)

* Note that creating a new candidate is different than editing a candidate. When creating a candidate, you can add all the data, including just 1 note with the imported talent POST endpoint: `/talent/{company_id}/import` . When editing, you have to show previous notes (as read-only), and then hit *two* different endpoints: `/talent/{company_id}/imported/{imported_id}` and `POST /employer-user/{user_id}/application-note`

**Tests:**

Integration test for single upload form that tests all necessary data is sent to endpoint

Integration test that verifies everything starts with the necessary data on edit, and upon submit the new data gets properly sent to the endpoint

Integration test for CSV Input component (e.g. the whole page) that tests all necessary data is sent to endpoint.

**Deliverables:**

* `/employer/bulk-upload` page works with CSV upload
* `/employer/bulk-upload` page works with single candidate upload
* `/employer/edit-candidate/[imported_id]` that allows editing a candidate
title: Actually call bulk upload endpoints (not finished)

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Fastify is using AJV which by default coerces types and strips additional properties while validating. We stand to improve frontend usage of the backend api by increasing the strictness of validation, and likely uncover some bugs too.

See the notes section on fastify: [https://github.com/seriousme/fastify-openapi-glue#notes](https://github.com/seriousme/fastify-openapi-glue#notes)

Also see the validation documentation here: [https://fastify.dev/docs/latest/Reference/Validation-and-Serialization/](https://fastify.dev/docs/latest/Reference/Validation-and-Serialization/)

**Details:**

* [X] Turn off filtering additional properties and see what breaks in backend and frontend tests
  * [X] Fix what you can easily fix
* [X] Turn off type coercion and see what breaks
  * [X] Fix what you can easily fix

**Tests:**

* [X] All current tests should pass (unless this reveals broken tests)
* [ ] Write new tests where needed

**Follow-up:**

* [ ] Write issues for validation failures that are too hard to fix as part of this issue
* [X] Make a recommendation for whether we should turn on this extra validation permanently

**Deliverables:**

<One line description of the primary objective...>
title: Tighten API Validation (copy)

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Running the `src/components/features/screening/ConfirmationModal/integration.test.tsx` test passes when you run it by itself, but it will fail if you run `yarn test:jest`. It seems to only be failing when you run a certain amount of other tests along with it, but it doesn't matter what those other tests are. 

The reason it it failing is because the contents of the modal is suspended, and it takes an unreasonably long time for the resource to resolve. Currently we have a band aid in place of manually increasing the timeout of a `waitFor`, but this seems like a symptom of a weird async race condition. 

**Details:**

* It will complain about not being able to find a quill editor, but I'm pretty sure that react quill is not the problem. You can make this a little more explicit by commenting out the quill stuff during development just to be sure. 
* Maybe try running it alongside a bunch of tests which *don't* hit the same endpoint, to see if the problem is something to do with msw.
* Try creating an entirely separate server instance of msw instead of using the one with `handlers.ts` to see if something is bleeding over unintentionally there.
* When I was poking around with adding console logs, it seemed like the async function in the suspense resource was finishing, but the actual `resource.read()` call was not. 
  * Double check that this is accurate
  * If it is, figure out why Suspense can't tell the resource is finished. (Potentially there is something else happening that Suspense is waiting on?)

**Follow-up:**

If you learn anything new about how we should be testing, teach the rest of the frontend team so we can avoid problems like this in the future. 

**Deliverables:**

ConfirmationModal integration test runs without having to increase the timeout.
title: ConfirmationModal test weirdness

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Right now, if you navigate to [http://test.redballoon.work:3001/publicsq](http://test.redballoon.work:3001/publicsq), if you then navigate to seeker registration, that seeker will be tagged with the publicsq tag.

**WE WILL NOT** be building this for public square, but we now want to *also* tag seekers with a badge from the partner page that they came from. So, for example, there will be a new `TPUSA` landing page, and we want to give seekers a specific tpusa badge if they come from that landing page when they complete their registration

**Details:**

* This issue is blocked by: [RB-978](https://linear.app/redballoon/issue/RB-978/add-badges)
* The badge will be equal to the partner path
  * `partner_path` key in the cookie will get you the key you need
  * pass in to the newly modified seeker patch endpoint from [RB-978](https://linear.app/redballoon/issue/RB-978/add-badges)
* We only want this to apply to the allowed badges (probably just have this hardcoded on the frontend for now)
  * 'tpusa' and 'nsa'
  * That way we don't get badges for publicsq when that shouldn't exist
* Hit the backend taxonomy endpoint to check which tags should be badges

**Tests:**

* A test to make sure that if the seeker has a `partner_path` in the `cookie` that it is equal to what is sent to the backend for the `badge` param
* Might want to write a mock function to mock putting a partner_path into the cookie called `tpusa` in case this issue gets pulled in before the tpusa landing page is complete

**Deliverables:**

*  If a seeker registers from a landing page, send the associated partner_path as a badge on registration as well
title: Partner Tag @ seeker registration assigns partner badge to seeker

**Background/Summary:**

If you [look at this chart](https://fly-metrics.net/d/fly-app/fly-app?from=now-24h&orgId=28432&to=now&var-app=rb-frontend2&viewPanel=11), it definitely is the case that we have a memory leak somewhere in our tool. We gotta isolate where it is and fix it.

**Details:**

* What we've done before:
  * Commented out Honeybadger source maps on the server side. Didn't work.
  * Took out PostHog entirely. Didn't work.
* Potential strategies:
  * Try commenting out Honeybadger entirely (client + server-side)
  * Try deleting entire swaths of pages, push up to a review app, monitor the memory usage

**Follow-up:**

Receive a hot chocolate from Bucers from Gabe as a thank you.

**Deliverables:**

* Memory leak is fixed.

There's gonna be a huge import of NSA and TP USA seekers. They shouldn't have to go through the 3-step registration process. It should be easier. 

**Details:**

* New page should be `/complete-registration`. 
* In `getServerSideProps()`, we will unseal and read `seeker_id` and `email` from the `lock` param. 
* Verify the seeker hasn't already signed up by pulling their information, and making sure the password still is `''`. If it's already filled out, then redirect the user to the login page
* Display a page similar to the [password reset request](https://www.redballoon.work/password-reset-request) page, that says 
  * Heading: "You're almost done!"
  * Subtext: "Set a password for your account and we'll log you in"
* Upon filling out a password, we should make a call to an endpoint (similar to `/api/reset-password` ) but instead of checking for a prior password reset, just set their password
* Redirect the seeker to the seeker profile

**Tests:**

Unit test the function that returns the action of what to do. (e.g. redirect to home, or proceed with login).

* Handle the following cases: 
  * Seeker hasn't signed up yet (happy path, proceed to registration completion)
  * Seeker has already signed up (redirect to home)

**Follow-up:**

Message Product General

Follow up with Aaron

Announce at stand-up to Backend team

Tell marketing

**Deliverables:**

1-click registration complete
title: Handle 1-click registration complete for Job Seekers

description:
## STILL WAITING TO HEAR BACK FROM TP USA ON DIRECTION FOR THIS

**Background/Summary:**

[Mock](https://www.figma.com/file/Q6uI3UgcX8yPJJXVlGORZc/TPUSA-landing-page?type=design&node-id=0-1&mode=design&t=P4hCi1lhng7NKkmR-0)

The design is completely re-vamped. 

**Details:**

NOTE: the form in the middle of the page should have first name, last name.

Note the sign up link goes needs to the job seeker sign up and include `partner=tpusa` as the tag.

Page path should be `/tpusa`. 

The form is for matching up seekers to their pre-loaded account. Here's the 3 possible things that can happen:

1. The user will already have a pre-loaded account on RB, but they just have to set their password. We redirect them to a page where they set their password and we log them in.
2. The user is already fully signed up (password is set and everything), so we redirect them to the login page with their email pre-filled out. (we'll need to add a new `query` param and check for that, like `email=test_tpusa_seeker@gmail.com`)
3. The user is a completely new user with an email that we didn't pre-load into our RB database. If that's the case, then redirect them to seeker registration with their email and name pre-filled out (add in an `email` query param and a `first_name` and `last_name` query param as well that we need to check for.)

### Assets:

![MicrosoftTeams-image (3).png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/9dc829fc-04c3-42e9-969a-d0c1729e534b/4c4a1d88-c6b9-4c46-a09c-cebab1de7be9)

**Details:**

  * [ ] will need to make the `employer_user_id` field nullable in case the changed status is caused by the system (e.g., when the employer cancels and all jobs revert to draft status)

* [ ] Remove the functional behavior of the `/log/posting-change` endpoint, but leave it there until the front end can remove their calls.

description:
**Background/Summary:**

There's 5 places in the operator dashboard that straight up reloads the page, and the operator loses all handle on where they are, and pretty much just life in general. There's some low hanging fruit that we can do to help the mental sanity of operators.

**Details:**

Add in the following query params, and instead of reloading, navigate to a new url with the query params. We'll then use the query params to re-initialize the page correctly to where they're at. 

**Query Params:**

1. `tab` - sets the current tab. Either `seeker`, `employer_user` or `company`
2. `last_name` - what to pre-fill in the last name input
3. `business_name` - what to pre-fill in the business name input
4. `email` - what to pre-fill in the email input
5. `show_pending` - Whether to just show pending companies, and it's either `true` or `false`

**Follow-up:**

This release is going to be YUGE. Message the following people/channels:

* Product General
* Madelyn
* Jacob
* Mindy

**Deliverables:**

Operators do not lose their place after any kind of action they do in the dashboard.
title: Make operator dashboard not as bad

description:
**Background/Summary:**

When an employer saves a job posting, we send them to the `/employer/view-postings` page. This page has a query param called `status`, which filters the job postings table to postings with a particular status. There is some weird behavior happening because we are sending the wrong query param, so it looks like the job posting vanished.

**Details:**

Modify the `EditPosting.tsx` file to do the following: 

* Right now the "Save" button sets the status param to an empty string, which allows all. It should set it to the current status of the posting. (Eg saving a draft should take you to status=draft and saving an edit to an already active posting should take you to status=active)
* The 'Publish' button should take you to active.
* The 'Un-publish' button button should take you to draft. (Currently it is taking you to active.)

There is also some weirdness happening in the getServerSideProps of `pages/employer/view-postings/index.tsx` which defaults to status=active when you don't pass in a query param. You will either need to modify that, or if it is necessary make sure that we are always passing the correct params. 

**Tests:**

* [ ] Saving a new unpublished posting as a draft takes you to draft 
* [ ] Publishing an unpublished posting takes you to active  
* [ ] Saving an edit to a published posting takes you to active
* [ ] Saving an edit to a draft takes you to draft
* [ ] Un-publishing an active posting takes you to draft
* [ ] Clicking the "My Jobs" link in the Nav Bar takes you to active

**Unit Tests:**

* [ ] The `getStatusForViewPostingsPage()` function

**Follow-up:**

Message Product General after shipping.

**Deliverables:**

After saving a posting, you are always able to immediately see that posting in the table.
title: Save posting redirect tweak

description:
**Background/Summary:**

In an effort to help make honeybadger usable again, it would be nice if this error was not cluttering up our honeybadger reporting:

[https://app.honeybadger.io/projects/103582/faults/92907610](https://app.honeybadger.io/projects/103582/faults/92907610)

Of all the React minified errors on production, this seems to be the one we get the most. 

**Details:**

* [https://legacy.reactjs.org/docs/error-decoder.html/?invariant=418](https://legacy.reactjs.org/docs/error-decoder.html/?invariant=418)

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/2522fb12-3667-462e-9043-a170001e7de1/826fc4ed-44df-4790-945f-6f6de09aeb91)

* This shows up on prod, every time you load the homepage:
* 

  ![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/d45d60fd-8e03-4b42-a4ca-6cce20926e1f/6bde88bc-163c-4992-a6c6-1b21cbe0c472)
* This is a hydration error, we know that this can be caused by the following:
  * `createPortal` is used and it is not dynamically imported so it causes the server and the client to be out of sync
  * `Suspense` is used and it is not dynamically imported so it causes the server and the client to be out of sync
  * `Window` object is used and it is not dynamically imported so it causes the server and the client to be out of sync
* **NOTE:** Something that would be **SUPER** helpful, would be if we figured out how to successfully run a fully minified production build locally so that we could test this.
  * Maybe talk to Jonathan about this

this error shows up on dev:

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/ae796cda-d836-4285-961a-44008f8bde99/a6108803-6027-47a4-9606-debdb02e0c5f)

I wonder if it is related at all ü§∑‍‚ôÇÔ∏è 

**Deliverables:**

* Get rid of the `React Minified Error 418`
* Be able to run production build on your local machine
title: React Minified Error: #418

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We want to give ourselves as much context as possible when looking at errors that are reported to Honeybadger.

**Engineering Notes:**

* `Honeybadger.notify(error, { context: info });`
* Every time an API request fails, we want the context for it. So whether you use `proxy`, `sparky`, `companyApi` class, `seekerApi` class (etc.) we want the context surrounding what went wrong.
  * We want:
    * `endpoint`
    * `query`
    * `body` (if it has one)
    * current user `cookies`
* This will give us a lot of insight into what went wrong and help us diagnose bugs quicker

**Deliverables:**

* More context surrounding API request failures in our tool
title: Honeybadger context with API requests
Failed to read `localStorage`

description:
**Background/Summary:**

[https://app.honeybadger.io/projects/103582/faults/101636571](https://app.honeybadger.io/projects/103582/faults/101636571)

[https://caniuse.com/?search=structuredClone](https://caniuse.com/?search=structuredClone)

**Details:**

* The user was using `14.1` Safari version and `structuredClone` is not supported in Safari versions less than `15.3`
* We have already started using polyfills in our `next.config.js`:

  ```
  config.resolve.alias.crypto = 'crypto-browserify';
  
  config.resolve.alias.stream = 'stream-browserify';
  ```
* [https://github.com/ungap/structured-clone](https://github.com/ungap/structured-clone)
* The problem shows up in `professionalDetailsReducer.tsx`
* This may have been a product of updating `webpack` (post webpack 5 they stop auto polyfilling for you)

Perhaps remove all our manual polyfills and use this:

[https://nextjs.org/docs/architecture/supported-browsers](https://nextjs.org/docs/architecture/supported-browsers)

**Deliverables:**

* Add a polyfill to our `next.config.js` as a fallback for `structuredClone` for browsers that do not support it
* Add a helpful comment above our polyfilling section in the webpack config to explain why that is there and what it is doing
title: Polyfill StructuredClone for old browsers

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We shipped our first big Honeybadger issue! We now have working source maps on production so that we can now see where the error came from. This specifically only works for client. Meaning server errors are not getting correctly tracked. We want to correctly track server errors

**Details:**

* `Honeybadger.server.config.js` will most likely be the place where you spend most of your time. This is where you configure how Honeybadger acts on the server
* You can use `Honeybadger.logger.debug('MESSAGE')` to log things as you are experimenting
* Here is an example app that is correctly logging errors on the server: [https://github.com/honeybadger-io/nextjs-with-honeybadger](https://github.com/honeybadger-io/nextjs-with-honeybadger)
  * We might just need to add in the assets URL to get this working

**Deliverables:**

* Get honeybadger reporting helpful errors from the Server
title: Helpful Honeybadger errors from Server

  * [ ] ***Category A: Manual Overrides:***** **These postings take precedence over all other jobs
  * [ ] ***Category B: 0 Application Jobs:***** **Jobs with 0 applications
  * [ ] ***Category C: High Performing Jobs:*** Remote jobs, or in-person jobs with >$80000 top range salary
* [ ] Priority order is Category A, then split the rest evenly between Category B and C¬†
* [ ] Links should be presented in the following format: [https://www.redballoon.work/linkedin-registration/\[job_id\]?utm_source=linkedin_job_post\_\[job_id\]\[posting_yymmdd](https://www.redballoon.work/linkedin-registration/\[job_id\]?utm_source=linkedin_job_post\_\[job_id\]\[posting_yymmdd)\]¬†
* [ ] 25% of jobs in category B and C should be swapped each day, so that all jobs are swapped every 4 days.¬†
* [ ] The date at the end of each link should be changed daily¬†
* [ ] Jobs in category B and C should be prioritized by least exposure to LinkedIn. We want exposure to be spread evenly for both
* [ ] (@steve Need documentation for XML feed)
* [ ] Remove closed jobs from feed

Front end work:

* [ ] Add toggle visible to operators on job postings for manual overrides
* [ ] Add Metabase query/question to show postings that are manually overridden

**Tests:**

* [ ] Add a unit test

**Follow-up:**

* [ ] Let @aaron know when this is done

**Deliverables:**

* [ ] Deliver RedBalloon jobs as a regularly updated XML feed

**Background/Summary:**

We want to start sending out automatic job alerts to job seekers. These are emails with matched jobs in their area (or remote jobs). A scheduled task will run every day which determines the list of jobs to send, whether to send, and then sends the email. 

**Details:**

Questions:

* [ ] Cross-reference with hubspot so we don't start sending emails to people who unsubscribed?
* [ ] Order by relevance or posted date?

Second issue (5 LOE)

* [ ] For every seeker that has not opted-out, run the same match algorithm we use to suggest jobs
  * [X] Suggest jobs in their area
  * [X] Suggest remote jobs
  * [X] Jobs are matched by skills
  * [ ] Show redirect jobs¬†
    * [ ] After seeker logs in, redirect them to third party job, and log the redirect application¬†¬†
* [ ] We want to give the seeker a max of 5 new jobs and a max of 15 old jobs
  * [ ] New jobs are defined as  jobs that we *have not* yet emailed them about
  * [ ] Need to add a new `automatic_job_alert_log` table to track when a job was last sent to a seeker
    * [ ] seeker_id (PK)
    * [ ] posting_id (PK)
    * [ ] created_at
    * [ ] updated_at
  * [ ] Old jobs are defined as jobs that we *have* emailed them about
* [ ] We need to retrieve the posting info to produce this:

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/7c8ee9f9-6286-425a-a9db-9113bbda3083/b5ce8fa4-c2f6-4432-9d2a-3ee423234a49)

* [ ] Order by relevance ~posted date~, newest to oldest
* [ ] We will continue sending the email daily until all the new jobs have been included in the alert; do not send the email if there are no new jobs
* [ ] Create a new endpoint for sending automatic job alerts
* [ ] Tests

**Tests:**

<What tests need to be added‚Ä¶>

<Write issues, communicate, etc...>

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We have the endpoints now to actually do something with the data when the user uses CSV import or the single upload form. We should use them.

**Details:**

New endpoint to upload: POST `/talent/{company_id}/import`

New endpoint to get the details for a previously uploaded candidate: `GET /talent/{company_id}/imported/{imported_id}`

Also need new page called `/employer/edit-candidate/[imported_id]` that is the same as bulk upload, but pre-populates with all the previously entered info from before for that candidate.

* Please **note** that when editing, you have to pull the notes via `/company/{company_id}/application-notes/{application_id}`, while the rest of the data comes from the imported talent GET endpoint (

  `GET /talent/{company_id}/imported/{imported_id}` )
* When updating the notes, you have to use the `POST /employer-user/{user_id}/application-note` endpoint
* Any previously-entered notes just render as read-only for now, so the user can't change it.

New endpoint to update candidate: `PATCH /talent/{company_id}/imported/{imported_id}`

Actually upload the file to R2.

When editing a candidate, the page needs to be able to support multiple notes sections (cause you can add multiple notes to a single candidate)

* Note that creating a new candidate is different than editing a candidate. When creating a candidate, you can add all the data, including just 1 note with the imported talent POST endpoint: `/talent/{company_id}/import` . When editing, you have to show previous notes (as read-only), and then hit *two* different endpoints: `/talent/{company_id}/imported/{imported_id}` and `POST /employer-user/{user_id}/application-note`

**Tests:**

Integration test for single upload form that tests all necessary data is sent to endpoint

Integration test that verifies everything starts with the necessary data on edit, and upon submit the new data gets properly sent to the endpoint

Integration test for CSV Input component (e.g. the whole page) that tests all necessary data is sent to endpoint.

**Deliverables:**

* `/employer/bulk-upload` page works with CSV upload
* `/employer/bulk-upload` page works with single candidate upload
* `/employer/edit-candidate/[imported_id]` that allows editing a candidate
title: Actually call bulk upload endpoints

description:
**Background/Summary:**

* Currently if two different suspenders have the same callback, and one of them calls the `updateResource` function, the other one will not detect the change, so its data will get stale. 
* Also, we haven't been able to use the `useTransistion` hook on any component that uses Suspender, which causes annoying flickering on updates. [Potentially relevant](https://react.dev/reference/react/useSyncExternalStore#caveats)?

**Details:**

There is a WIP branch titled `resource-manager-update`. 

How to deal with the `updateResource` bug:

* Option 1: kill `useSyncExternalStore`. Instead, just use regular `useState` and a `WeakMap` to store the resources and callbacks. Manually update the state of every component that has used that callback to force a re-render when the resource changes.
* Option 2: Move the listeners to the global scope. Use a `WeakMap` keyed on callback to store arrays of listeners for each callback. This is what is implemented on the WIP branch. I got it working on an old commit, but for some reason when I moved the changes to the current checkout it broke. If we figure out what changed, this should be fairly simple to get working. 

**Tests:**

Test manually on the test page. Make sure to go through edge cases where things tend to get weird:

* [ ] Sibling Suspenders with the same callback
* [ ] Sibling Suspenders with different callbacks
* [ ] Nested Suspenders
* [ ] Turn on network throttling or just manually add delays to the callbacks so that the loading states are more visible

**Deliverables:**

* If there are two sibling Suspenders with the same callback, and one of them calls `updateResource`, BOTH of them update. 
*  `useTransition` is added to Suspender to avoid awkward flickering.
title: ResourceManager v2

* If `uploaded_resume`, show the section to the right. 
  * This should probably be a component we have in suspense so that:
    * it is more responsive
    * it is testable
    * it is reusable
    * it is ***recyclable***


  * This section will call a backend endpoint (of unkown identity for know) to get the things we need for the links.
  * There can only be a max of 6 results, when there is more have a "See All" link
  * If there are no results, don't show
  * Results should slide in as animations, similar to the results from the resume
    * Bonus: Try doing this without a `useEffect`
  * The Show More link will send in some search params to our `/search` page
    * Build out the search params from what we get from the backend
    * You can likely do something similar to what we do  
  * Make sure to open everything in a new window
  * Make sure to ***not*** restyle the apply button, that's just an old screenshot
* Talk with Steve or Gabe regarding what the shape of this endpoint is. We'll need to utilize localStorage because we're going to get back embeddings, and that can sometimes be longer than what you can stuff into a url's query params (max length of urls on chrome are \~2,000 chars)

**Tests:**

Test the component and make sure everything renders correctly (for <=6 results, >6 results, no results)

Test any helper function for building the job search url

Notify Product General, Aaron

Add link to jobs to apply to after registration

description:
**Background/Summary:**

In the interview finding section on the interview tab in ATS, you have these inputs to add an interview finding:

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/bd6cd7be-a422-4ec8-a0d6-9f8db2d1b404/af2c6050-ae36-4753-8f47-e1ae1f920b7a)

We want the user to be able to select a type, then select a screening criteria, and it will auto fill out some text in the big text editor below. These will be called our interview criteria templates. The employer user should not be able to make these templates on their own, it will require an operator to make these. The point of this issue is to build a UI in the operator dashboard, so that an operator can create templates for the employer.

**Details:**

* There are 5 criteria for each employer, there are 3 types of criteria, that means there needs to be 15 templates.
* There is no mock for what this would look like in the operator dashboard.
  * Could build a table, with types as the rows, and the columns as the criteria. Each cell would open a modal with a text editor for the text that would be the combination of the two.

**Deliverables:**

* Build a UI in the operator dashboard for the operator to be able to create 15 templates for criteria for a specified employer user
title: Operator - Create Criteria Templates (NOT FINISHED)

description:
**Background/Summary:**

When inputting scores on ats with keyboard shortcuts, sometimes you can run into some weird behavior. 

**Details:**

How to repro:

* Select a score with a keyboard shortcut, then try to immediately change that same score (eg, press, 2 then 3). You cant unless you first go back and forth with the arrow keys to refocus. (This is probably the most common one)
* Move with the arrows to focus on a criterion, then click somewhere else on the page, then click a number. Nothing happens, even though it looks like the criterion is still focused. 
* Turn on network throttling and try pressing number‚Üíarrow‚Üínumber pretty fast. Sometimes the first score doesn't get  applied. 
* I don't know how, but I managed to get a couple of errors `TypeError: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'focus')` in `src/components/features/screening/ScoresInput/hook.tsx` lines 126 and 111.

**Tests:**

Manually test that the bugs are gone

**Follow-up:**

Notify Aaron.

**Deliverables:**

Scores input behavior is expected.
title: Scores input focus bug

description:
![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/9f9e9023-3360-4714-82a5-a082073b2cba/bfe014d5-b44b-4e50-93d0-0f6af54f4e3e)

**Background/Summary:**

Now we finally get to do the fun part: delete 11 files and over 1000 lines of code.

**Details:**

Now that we have up to date types from the backend in the `backend_types.d.ts` file, we should be able to use those types instead of the ones in `/src/api-wrappers/**/*-data-structures.ts`. Also, we will no longer need the tests that check if we are getting the right shape of data from the backend. 

* Delete all 5 api test files.
* Delete all 5 api type files, and replace all instances of their types with the appropriate backend types. (Most of these occurrences will be in the api wrappers.)
* Move the api wrappers up a level since they don't each need their own directory anymore.
* Get rid of `superstruct` !!

**Follow-up:**

Message the frontend team and tell them to all merge master and resolve any merge conflicts, since this will probably affect basically every issue in progress.

**Deliverables:**

Types from the backend, instead of frontend manually re-defining the response types.
title: Types refactor

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Now we want to automatically run the update_types.bash script to keep frontend in sync with the backend. The main goals for this are:

* Every time you start up your local docker, it should automatically pull types from your local backend.
* On every frontend pipeline, it should pull types from qa-backend, and then run a typescript compile. 
* On every backend merge, it should cause the master branch of frontend to pull types and do a typescript compile. (This should happen automatically after you do the step above since backend merges already run the frontend CI.)

**Details:**

Do not go through the entire frontend and swap out types from the ones defined in the api-wrappers just yet. Instead, add a couple types from `backend_types.d.ts` to the test-page so that we can verify everything works without accidentally breaking anything. 

* Add a step to the frontend Dockerfile which calls the update_types script. 
* Add a job to .gitlab-ci.yml which fetches the types and runs a typescript compile. (While you are at it make it check linting as well)
* Verify that the above job runs correctly when frontend does a merge.

**Tests:**

Manually test the following:

* VScode intellisense for types from the backend works as expected. (RED SQUIGGLES)
* If you push frontend code which accesses a non-existent attribute of a backend type, the typescript compiler catches it and the pipeline fails. 
* If you merge backend code with BREAKING changes to the types (eg you remove an attribute the frontend uses), the compiler catches it and the pipeline fails.
  * Obviously be careful to test this in a way that will not accidentally break things if something goes wrong. Maybe have /Ste(ph|v)e(n)?/ and or Jonathan look over your shoulder for the dummy backend changes.
* If you merge backend code with non-breaking changes to the types (eg you add a new property to a type, or remove an unused property) the pipeline passes.

**Follow Up:**

Tell frontend and backend

Also tell everyone to pull master on rb-docker

**Deliverables:**

Frontend has a types file from the backend, which does not require manual action to create. Typechecking happens in the CI and locally.
title: Auto updating types

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We want to be able to use the backend's types instead of re-defining a good chunk of their codebase. To do this, we will need a bash script to fetch their openApi spec file and generate the types.

**Details:**

Hit the `/types` endpoint created in RB-884 to fetch the `openApi.yml` file.

Use [dtsgenerator](https://www.npmjs.com/package/dtsgenerator) to generate a `backend_types.d.ts` file. There is an example of how to use it in the backend `package.json`

Put both openApi.yml and backend_types.d.ts into the gitignore. 

Add a yarn command to `package.json` so we can run the new script easily.

(Nice to have, but don't hurt yourself) - If this is running locally, check the backend checkout against the current head of master. If it is out of date, ask if they want to update their backend. Eg "Your local backend is on commit 000000, but master is currently on 000001. Would you like to update? \[y/n\]". This should be similar to what Stephen did with the lago checkout thing. Make sure this isn't going to be annoying to the backend guys.

**Tests:**

Manually test that the final types file has the same types as the backend file `types.d.ts`. 

NOTE: we really only care about the `Components.Schemas` section of the code. The backend does some post-processing on the types for the endpoint responses, so there will be differences there, but it doesn't really matter because we aren't going to use that.

**Deliverables:**

Script works.

DON'T try to make the script run automatically in the CI or in the Dockerfile or anything like that. Just make sure that it works when you run it manually. We will deal with adding it to the CI in another issue.
title: Update types script

description:

* [X] Return: The contents of `openApi.yml`. I couldn't find anywhere that explained how to do an actual file stream with fastify api glue, so you might need to basically just stringify the contents of the file and return it as a massive string.
  * [X] This should require the `API_KEY`param. 
* [X] Add this endpoint to the `RE_NEVER_ALLOWED_ENDPOINTS` array in the frontend `/src/utils/proxy-helpers.ts`

**Tests:**

* Gets the correct contents when hit correctly

`/types` endpoint

**Background/Summary:**

description:
**Background/Summary:**

There's a lot of this kind of error. Most of them are things that *could* be undefined or null, but we assume it has something. There's too many for one issue, so we're gonna chunk it out. 

**Details:**

As a reminder, to turn on strict TypeScript you do the following:

1. Open tsconfig.json
2. Change it to say `"strict": true`
3. Remove the line that says `"strictNullChecks": false`

Most of these are fixed by doing one of the following:

1. Do a `?? ''` so that we can still default to an empty string 
2. Do an `if()` check and throw an error if the item is null or undefined 
3. Fix a type on a component/function for arguments that default to undefined or null.

**Tests:**

Manually browse to all the relevant pages that you change. No integration tests needed. 

**Follow-up:**

Update the number of TypeScript compiler errors we've fixed on the whiteboard.

**Deliverables:**

50+ less "is not assignable to type" errors
title: Fix 50 "is not assignable to type" errors

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Lago did not always have a means of scheduling the end of a subscription, so we created a plan called `no-plan-v1`aliased as `NoPlan` in the backend code. Whenever a customer cancelled, we scheduled a downgrade to `NoPlan`for the end of their current billing period. 

Recently, Lago added the ability the schedule the termination of a subscription, so we can now use that instead of NoPlan. Removing the old (hacky) mechanism will not be difficult, but we must be careful to make sure we do not introduce bugs into the billing system.

**Details:**

* [ ] Remove no-plan-v1 from employers and hubspot DAOs and also from the plans list in the db directory.
* [ ] Remove no-plan-v1 from the rb-docker repo
* [ ] Do a search for NoPlan in the backend repo and remove all references
  * [ ] getPackageHistory (double check that there are no entries with no-plan-v1 in the purchase history table)
  * [ ] double check the logic for all usages of `LimitedPlans`
  * [ ] refactor cancelPlan logic to
    * [ ] look for pending cancellation rather than `next_package_code = NoPlan`
    * [ ] set `endingAt` on the subscription instead of adding a downgrade to NoPlan
  * [ ] policeCreditBalance shouldn't need to filter any plans out anymore, unless we want to filter out ground crew?
  * [ ] remove noplan test case from customer-at-risk tests
  * [ ] update refreshLifeCycleStage logic for setting the CancelationMQL
  * [ ] refactor filterAtRiskCustomers logic
  * [ ] update tests for isPayingCustomer et cetera in employer.spec.ts
  * [ ] update purchase order tests to account for pending cancellations rather than NoPlan
* [ ] Search frontend code for `no-plan-v1` and `NoPlan` and remove/update logic as necessary
* [ ] Update Metabase queries that rely on the existence of No Plan plan

**Tests:**

* [ ] Update cancellation and other tests that reference NoPlan

**Follow-up:**

* [ ] After all is merged, post on product general and rejoice with Jacob (champagne?)
* [ ] Remove NoPlan from Lago on QA and Prod

**Deliverables:**

Package system is simpler and easier to understand and thus less prone to errors.
title: Remove NoPlan

Invest in additional LinkedIn job slots in order to drive customer satisfaction and retention and facilitate job post automation.

**Details:**

* [ ] Exclude all jobs which do not allow cross-posting¬†
* [ ] Split the jobs as follows:¬†
  * [ ] ***Category A: Manual Overrides:***** **These postings take precedence over all other jobs
  * [ ] ***Category B: 0 Application Jobs:***** **Jobs with 0 applications
  * [ ] ***Category C: High Performing Jobs:*** Remote jobs, or in-person jobs with >$80000 top range salary
* [ ] Priority order is Category A, then split the rest evenly between Category B and C¬†
* [ ] Links should be presented in the following format: [https://www.redballoon.work/linkedin-registration/\[job_id\]?utm_source=linkedin_job_post\_\[job_id\]\[posting_yymmdd](https://www.redballoon.work/linkedin-registration/\[job_id\]?utm_source=linkedin_job_post\_\[job_id\]\[posting_yymmdd)\]¬†
* [ ] 25% of jobs in category B and C should be swapped each day, so that all jobs are swapped every 4 days.¬†
* [ ] The date at the end of each link should be changed daily¬†
* [ ] Jobs in category B and C should be prioritized by least exposure to LinkedIn. We want exposure to be spread evenly for both
* [ ] (@steve Need documentation for XML feed)
* [ ] Remove closed jobs from feed

Front end work:

* [ ] Add toggle visible to operators on job postings for manual overrides
* [ ] Add Metabase query/question to show postings that are manually overridden

description:
**Background/Summary:**

When an employer buys an annual package, then later clicks the "Switch to this package" button on a monthly package, it leads to all sorts of unexpected behavior. They keep their annual credits but also get their monthly ones. They are still charged for the annual package, but the money now goes toward offsetting their monthly subscription instead of just paying for a year. This leads to them calling Jacob/Madelyn and us having to manually change things in lago/the db in order to fix everything.

To avoid this unfortunate situation, we want to hide the "Switch to this package" button on the monthly section of the purchase now page. Essentially, if you commit to annual, you're getting annual. 

**Details:**

Modify the `getButton` function to check the following:

* Does the user have an annual package? (check this by seeing if the text `"annual"` is in the package code)
* Is the package for this button a monthly package?
* If yes to both the above, do NOT show the button.

**Tests:**

Update the unittest for getButton.

**Follow-up:**

Message in product general. Tag Aaron.

**Deliverables:**

"Switch to this Package" does not show up on monthly plans for users with a currently active annual subscription.
title: No annual to monthly switching

description:
**Background/Summary:**

* In the 2 years since RedBalloon‚Äôs inception, the most common complaint from Job Seekers has been that they can‚Äôt find jobs to meet their needs.¬†¬†
* In addition, Employers often conduct a local search for their kind of job before choosing to sign up with RedBalloon, and choose not to purchase if they don‚Äôt see companies like theirs.¬†¬†
* Finally, aggregating jobs into the RedBalloon search results may solve the problems mentioned about while not dampening the pent up demand from new employers, the way a free product would.¬†

**Details:**

* [X] Identify feasibility of scraping jobs from the SMB business population of which we are a part by surveying the similarities/differences between the career site job posts of 20 randomly selected former RB Employers.¬†¬†
* [X] In addition, survey 20 NowSite customers that we have gathered information for.¬†
* [X] Get an estimate of total # of jobs likely to be captured by this effort by applying the success rates of the above to business populations we have access to (such as PublicSQ).¬†
* [ ] Be able to estimate the effort needed to complete this feature within 5 LOE¬†

**Follow-up:**

* [ ] Communicate research results to Aaron (schedule a meeting if necessary)
* [ ] Write any necessary follow-up issues to do the work

**Deliverables:**

* [ ] Research results
* [ ] Implementation issues
title: Research - Aggregate Additional Jobs Into RedBalloon Search

description:
### **Fix #1: "Cancel Auto-renewal" link**

Instead of just saying "Cancel" on the purchase now page, we should have it say "Cancel Auto-renewal". We're doing this to address a lot of customer calls that Mindy's been having where the customer is confused on how to cancel. They're not sure if it'll cancel everything immediately, or just merely cancels their subscription from auto-renewing.

Bump the cancel link down to be under neath the button

CHECK MOBILE

### Fix #2: Location-based job posting error

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/2ad41928-4c53-41ba-8cc5-c853e074eacd/9cd17727-f792-43e9-8c06-0b734b8daa3e)

How to repro:

1. Create and save a job that's remote. Do NOT put in a location.
2. Go back and edit that job.
3. Switch it to say "Location-based", *and then immediately try to save*.
4. Observe huge error

This is due to yup's schema validation, we need to re-initialize the input as an `''` and we'll avoid this error.

### Fix #3: Conditionally send job fill metric

Do not send a request to `/job-fill-metric` when the user immediately closes out of the feedback modal (without even clicking any radio button, OR filling out the feedback). Double check this for when employers cancel from the pricing page too.

### Fix #4: Replace photo on homepage

![ac-shaking-hand.jpeg](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/d2e2b4a3-90a4-4456-9018-31b92818a177/2ba7434b-3abd-4466-8448-f4f16b55eb86)

This is for marketing, let's replace the photo of Gabe shaking Andrew's hand with the one above. Make this grayscale just like before.

### **Fix #5: Send in "cancelled" for the job fill action when employers cancel via the pricing page**

Added to scope.

description:
**Background/Summary:**

If we add a location dropdown/search to the seeker update page, then we can get better more standardized seeker locations which can help connect the two sides of our market better, whenever geography is involved. There are two benefits to offering this: (1) if a seeker makes a mistake, we can catch it for them (2) if our classification in resume search isn't great, we can take the hint and prompt the seeker to fix it. 

It's pretty easy to communicate to the seeker the value of having an accurate location: "Hey! Employers can find you better if your city is a known combination of city/state. We can also give you more personalized job recommendations to matching you with employers that are posting jobs in your area!"

This will add an extra step to seeker registration whenever we are not able to match the city in their resume to our populated places dataset. There could be some possible frustration if they are unable to find their city in our dropdown.

**Details:**

Better geo search experience for employers and better match experience for job seekers.

**Background/Summary:**

In the interview finding section on the interview tab in ATS, you have these inputs to add an interview finding:

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/bd6cd7be-a422-4ec8-a0d6-9f8db2d1b404/af2c6050-ae36-4753-8f47-e1ae1f920b7a)

We want the user to be able to select a type, then select a screening criteria, and it will auto fill out some text in the big text editor below. These will be called our interview criteria templates. The employer user should not be able to make these templates on their own, it will require an operator to make these. The point of this issue is to build a UI in the operator dashboard, so that an operator can create templates for the employer.

**Details:**

* There are 5 criteria for each employer, there are 3 types of criteria, that means there needs to be 15 templates.
* There is no mock for what this would look like in the operator dashboard.
  * Could build a table, with types as the rows, and the columns as the criteria. Each cell would open a modal with a text editor for the text that would be the combination of the two.

**Deliverables:**

* Build a UI in the operator dashboard for the operator to be able to create 15 templates for criteria for a specified employer user
title: Operator - Create Criteria Templates

description:
## TALK WITH GABE BEFORE STARTING THIS ISSUE!

**Background/Summary:**

We currently write unit tests that are actually making real API requests to the backend to check it the backend API's are returning what we expect. This accounts for several of our unit tests and is starting to add up. The reason we have to do this is because we are not sharing types between backend and frontend. This also means we have several files with 100s of lines of code that is duplicated from backend types.

**Details:**

* Because the backend is use Open API spec, there are already some tools out there for sharing types between backend and frontend that we might be able to leverage
* One thing we want to be aware of when researching this, is that we don't want the backend to have to change the frontend every time they change and endpoint.
* Another thing that we don't want is a separate repo. That would mean that every time backend wants to make a change they would have to modify two repos
* [https://medium.com/@suraj.kc/use-swagger-to-generate-api-client-in-frontend-60b7d65abf31](https://medium.com/@suraj.kc/use-swagger-to-generate-api-client-in-frontend-60b7d65abf31)

**Deliverables:**

* Research different solutions for sharing types between backend and frontend
* Team Discussion to decide on best way
* Create follow up issues on this epic `Shared Types` to finish the job
title: Research sharing API types between backend and frontend

**Background/Summary:**

To properly integrate with RezGenie, we need a way for users to generate an API key so that RezGenie can interact with RedBalloon's API's without them having to be in the tool. 

**Details:**

On the Edit Account Details page for employers, add a section called "Manage API Keys". This links to another page, at `/employer/api-keys`.

The new page has a simple table, and a button called "Generate API Key". Hit the endpoints found in [RB-779](https://linear.app/redballoon/issue/RB-779/api-token-endpoints) . When the POST returns, show the newly generated API key with a "Copy" button, that copies it to their clipboard. 

Any previously generated API keys should be shown in the table. 

API keys should be able to be deleted as well. 

Table should have API key, and the trash can icon. When the trash can icon is clicked, it should double check to confirm the user really wants to delete the icon.

Limit 10 api keys

**Tests:**

Integration test that tests the following:

* Click button and test that the right endpoint gets called to generate API key
* Proper GET call happens to re-pull all the employers' API keys
* Delete button click sends proper DELETE fetch call 

**Follow-up:**

Let Steve and the backend team know this is done

**Deliverables:**

* New employer page that allows users to generate API keys
title: Generate API Keys

description:
## **Background/Summary:**

We need more dataz around why employers are closing their job. It's pretty minimal right now. 

[Mock](https://www.figma.com/file/ZPbLshI7fBlnFt9UJB5dVi/Web-Design-Edits?type=design&node-id=0-1&mode=design&t=smUgH68XtZSWa5Ve-0)

## **Details:**

**For closing a Job Posting:**

* For closing a job posting, we'll be re-using the same endpoint from before: `/company/{company_id}/job-fill-metric`.
* The endpoint will be augmented to handle multiple codes.
* The codes the backend team will use in the backend for the fill `status` will be `hired-rb`, `hired-other`, and `not-hired`
* The status codes are going to be in a taxonomy table, so you can generate dynamically in the modals, if you would like.

**For when a company cancels:**

* Hit the same endpoint as before: `/company/{company_id}/cancel/{plan_code}`
* Send in the same kind of status codes as above.

## **Tests:**

Integration test that verifies the following:

* On Close button click, a modal shows up on the page
* On Cancel link click on the pricing page, a modal shows up on the page
* When modal(s) are filled out and Finish button is clicked, a network request is sent with the data that we expect.

## **Follow-up:**

Tell Aaron, post on Product General

## **Deliverables:**

* Improved modal when job postings are closed
* Modal shows up upon cancel link clicked
title: Improved Job Closure Modal (rollover)

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Revere pay occasionally has hiccups and we don't want this to take down our billing logic. So far, the blips have not caused problems, and the Lago invoice retry logic has helped us out, but it's a real possibility that we get into some weird state if a RP request dies unexpectedly.

Example of this happening: [https://app.honeybadger.io/projects/103581/faults/100222472](https://app.honeybadger.io/projects/103581/faults/100222472)

Revere pay fetch requests all go through a single function in the billing dao: `reverePayFetchRequest`.

**Details:**

* [X] Add retry logic to the function, similar to how mail send or affinda

**Tests:**

* [X] ~Add a test that makes sure the retry logic works (only retries three times, actually does retry).~  It was impossible to get fetch to fail, given the inputs. RP would always return a 404 or 400. 

**Follow-up:**

None.

**Deliverables:**

More robust billing system
title: Revere Pay Fetch Retries

If this method yields bad results for job postings, write an issue to use word embeddings. Here is the start:

    * it is reusable
    * it is ***recyclable***


  * This section will call a backend endpoint (of unkown identity for know) to get the things we need for the links.
  * There can only be a max of 6 results, when there is more have a "See All" link
  * If there are no results, don't show
  * Results should slide in as animations, similar to the results from the resume
    * Bonus: Try doing this without a `useEffect`
  * The Show More link will send in some search params to our `/search` page
    * Build out the search params from what we get from the backend
    * You can likely do something similar to what we do  
  * Make sure to open everything in a new window
  * Make sure to ***not*** restyle the apply button, that's just an old screenshot
* Talk with Steve or Gabe regarding what the shape of this endpoint is. We'll need to utilize localStorage because we're going to get back embeddings, and that can sometimes be longer than what you can stuff into a url's query params (max length of urls on chrome are \~2,000 chars)

**Tests:**

Test the component and make sure everything renders correctly (for <=6 results, >6 results, no results)

Test any helper function for building the job search url

**Follow-up:**

Notify Product General, Aaron

**Deliverables:**

Add link to jobs to apply to after registration
title: Job Search based on Resume at the end of registration
Highlight matched terms in profile search

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We're heavily discounting annual purchases, and so we want to promote that. Right now we default to showing the tab that the user has purchased a package from, and if the user hasn't puchased a package, then default to showing monthly. We want to switch this default to showing annual.

**Charter:**

[https://redballoonllc.sharepoint.com/sites/all/Shared%20Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?OR=Teams%2DHL&CT=1694014126897&clickparams=eyJBcHBOYW1lIjoiVGVhbXMtRGVza3RvcCIsIkFwcFZlcnNpb24iOiIxNDE1LzIzMDgwNDA4NjM2IiwiSGFzRmVkZXJhdGVkVXNlciI6ZmFsc2V9&id=%2Fsites%2Fall%2FShared%20Documents%2FProduct%2FCharters%2F230901%20%2D%20Annual%20Pricing%20Change&viewid=a9accf7d%2D1ae1%2D4780%2D9ed9%2D07850ccc736a](https://redballoonllc.sharepoint.com/sites/all/Shared%20Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?OR=Teams%2DHL&CT=1694014126897&clickparams=eyJBcHBOYW1lIjoiVGVhbXMtRGVza3RvcCIsIkFwcFZlcnNpb24iOiIxNDE1LzIzMDgwNDA4NjM2IiwiSGFzRmVkZXJhdGVkVXNlciI6ZmFsc2V9&id=%2Fsites%2Fall%2FShared%20Documents%2FProduct%2FCharters%2F230901%20%2D%20Annual%20Pricing%20Change&viewid=a9accf7d%2D1ae1%2D4780%2D9ed9%2D07850ccc736a)

**Mock:**

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/ab9f2bcd-9b19-4c57-bb7a-13ec278fd191/46c30dce-c396-48f7-8233-64012d0015b3)

**Details:**

Note when links in the columns are clicked, then it switches the tab. 

Things are hard coded, just keep it that way.

Remember to change this on mobile too. Mobile has cards instead of the pricing table.

This affects the `/employer-info` and the `/employer/purchase-now` pages

New Lago plans will be created by backend team:

* `~entrepreneur-annual-v2~` this was actually already $50/mo anyways so we are just re-using the one from before
* `standard-annual-v3`
* `plus-annual-v2`

Note the monthly plans will NOT be incremented, since they're the same.

**Additional Scope**

* Remove the "per Month" on the Job Postings row, it doesn't make sense. It's just the number of postings they'll have, they don't accrue more every month.
* When the "Annual" tab is selected, display "Profile Credits per Year" instead of "Profile Credits per Month". 
* COMPLETELY UNRELATED BUT IMPORTANT: add in a `scrollToTop()` call whenever the next or previous button is clicked
* Remove the Half Off Modal from the pricing page

**Tests:**

Unit test a function called `getPricingTabToShow(user)` that returns what tab to show. It should handle the following cases:

* User has a monthly package.
* User has an annual package
* User has a custom package
* User has no package

**Follow-up:**

Tell Aaron, Danny and Andrew.

**Deliverables:**

* Pricing page is updated.
title: Make annual pricing page

description:
**Background/Summary:**

When an employer changes the status of a job posting, we send a beacon call to log the change. That's getting a CSRF error. We should fix that. And really anywhere where we're doing `navigator.sendBeacon()`. Or switch it to a regular `Proxy` call. 

Funny enough, other `navigator.sendBeacon()` calls seem to be working great. So we're just gonna fix this one. 

**How to Repro:**

Publish or unpublish a job posting as an employer. Notice the CSRF `401` error we get on the `/api/log/posting-change` call. That shouldn't be happening. You can see things log all the way through by doing a select on the `job_posting_log` table.

**Deliverables:**

No more CSRF errors when changing the status of job postings.
title: CSRF Bug

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Some problems cropped up in the middle of development of ATS part 1. Namely:

1. We need the order of applicants to show up ordered by the posting, and then by the posted date descending. It will help streamline things for the user and make things a lot easier to understand.
   1. Backend will be adding a `sort_by` param to `/company/{company_id}/applicants`, and we'll need to send `posting_id,application_datetime:desc` 
2. The ATS experience should be enabled for *specific* postings via operators while emulating the employer user. Show this toggle in Section 4 right under the URL Redirect input:

   ![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/d13d6eb1-1183-47f6-906e-23ca2b4dd2a6/9fa9118b-df34-4548-902a-e3a1f81cc213)
   1. Note that this toggle should *only* show up when the user is emulated via an operator.
   2. When this is toggled on, we'll  `ats_enabled: true` on the normal PATCH request to edit the posting.
3. Applications to ATS-enabled postings in the Application table should have the link go directly to the ATS page, instead of the seeker profile like they do now. Add a new column to ATS Note this should *only* happen for applications to postings that have ATS enabled on it, and not *every* posting.

**Tests:**

Update E2E test for job posting and verify that the new toggle for turning on the job posting is actually saving.

**Deliverables:**

* Applications on ATS screening are properly sorted
* Operators can toggle on ATS screening experience via employer user emulation
* Application table links go to ATS screening instead of seeker profile for ATS-enabled postings
title: Implement in new misc backend functionality

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Currently, if a company is on a legacy or custom package, and their payment fails, the purchase now page hides all the buttons. 

![Selection_215.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/bcf76d36-3a00-4091-a5c7-3737c565c6b7/dc8964c0-aca6-4951-993e-448ddbd6fa8e)

For the table itself, this is expected behavior, so no need to touch the `getButtonType` function. What we want to do is show a message that explains the problem, and allow them to either update payment info or cancel (not doing so is *technically* illegal, so that's fun). This should be displayed above the table 

![Selection_216.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/6b5dd9c5-ab7b-4a42-b584-fa32f67cdd36/5d010f87-97ff-40a3-a9af-6a1a477f291e)

To repro, create a new, empty, employer. Go to lago, and add a custom or legacy plan. Then, go to the purchase-now page (without paying or adding payment info). 

**Details**:

Check the `user` object's packages array and see if any of the plans are both not normal ones and have payment pending. If so, display the message and links. 

Just hardcode the list of normal plans to be entrepreneur, standard, plus, and recruiter. Don't forget to include monthly and annual versions.

**Tests:**

Unittest for the function that checks for not normal plans.

**Follow-up:**

Message in Product General to let the team know that this is fixed.

**Deliverables:**

Customers can see when they have a pending purchase which is not for one of the 4 default options."

"You currently have a legacy or custom package(s), click here to cancel, or here to change your payment information."

"Your package ends on <Date>"

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We've now tried twice to clean up the posting CRUD operations and have failed. The latest attempt was [RB-703](https://linear.app/redballoon/issue/RB-703/fix-posting-patch). It's surprisingly tricky to reason about, and this is partially due to incorrect types defined at the top of the posting dao. In order to approach the code with confidence, we need to know we're not breaking things, which means tests.

**Details:**

* [ ] Write tests that posts all possible values for every field in a posting
* [ ] Write a test that updates all fields in the posting to each possible value (including excluded!)
* [ ] Check the above tests by calling the GET endpoints
* [ ] Document anything that is broken. DO NOT FIX ANY BUGS. Reduce the broken tests as much as possible to create regression tests and `chai.skip()`them.

**Follow-up:**

* [ ] Based on what you learn, write issues to
  * [ ] Fix the bugs
  * [ ] Get rid of (or fix) the ad hoc types at the top of the posting dao
  * [ ] Fix the openapi spec to make the fields not nullable

**Deliverables:**

Pay off tech debt and make sure this critical part of our code works correctly.
title: Write more detailed posting tests

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Somehow, Palpatine returned‚Ä¶

~When you got to the Employer Edit Account page, somehow a page view is not tracked. Even with our bullet proof hook ~`~useInitialRenderCallback~`~.~

**Details:**

* ~For some reason ~`~\_app.tsx~`~ does not unmount and remount when going from any page to the ~`~Edit Account Details~`~ page~
* ~Looks like this might also be because we did not add the interval checker to the other useEffect that tracks page views~
* **NOTE:** HERE IS ACTUALLY WHAT IS HAPPENING:
  * When you go to `/employer-info` and click the `Sign Up` button on one of the package columns, it will take you through the registration process for an employer.
  * When you make it through registration, you are greeted with the payment page.
  * **ONE PROBLEM** if you go through employer registration by clicking on the sign up link in the top right corner, when you purchase a package, it will pass along a query param `registration_complete=true` because we are not using the other way, that doesn't get passed, therefore analytics are not fully tracking when people make it all the way through registration.
* Perhaps a way to test that page views are accurately being tracked:

**Follow-up:**

* Tell Aaron when you fix it

**Deliverables:**

* The `registration_complete` query param gets added, even when a user goes through registration through the `employer-info` route
title: Track finished_registration when signing up as employer

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Currently, we ask employers if they have filled a job when the close or delete the job posting. Instead of only asking if the posting was filled, we want to ask if they hired through RB, hired through someone else, or failed to hire for the position. Following that, we want to give them a chance to provide free-form feedback. This data needs to make its way to HubSpot, as well.

Initial work needs to be backward compatible. After frontend changes are done, we will go back and clean-up.

**Details:**

* [X] Add a `fill_status_codes` taxonomy table to the db
  * [X] name: `hired-rb` display_name: `I hired through RedBalloon`
  * [X] name: `hired-other` display_name: `I hired through someone else`
  * [X] name: `not-hired` display_name: `I did not hire`
  * [X] Add `fill_status_codes` to taxonomy table list
* [X] Add a nullable `status` column to the `job_fill` table that references the `fill_status_codes` id
* [X] Add a nullable `feedback` column to the `job_fill` table
* [X] Modify `POST /company/{company_id}/job-fill-metric` 
  * [X] Take an optional `status` property in the body
  * [X] Make `filled` optional and calculate status based on the `filled` property if `status` is not defined
  * [X] Take an optional feedback property in the body


* [X] Update HubSpot
  * [X] Add `hired_rb` property to HubSpot companies (ask Steve to help do this)
  * [X] If `hired_rb` is true:
    * [X] update to true if status is `hired_rb`
  * [X] Add note to company
    * [X] Action: Closed Posting | Deleted Posting
    * [X] Posting Title: ‚Ä¶
    * [X] Status: (use taxonomy display names: Hired through RB | Hired through someone else | Did not hire)
    * [X] Feedback: ‚Ä¶

**Tests:**

* [X] Modify tests to account for the changes

**Follow-up:**

Made Issue => RB-788

* [X] Write issue to clean-up after frontend changes are made
  * [X] Backfill the `status` column
  * [X] Drop the `filled` column
  * [X] Remove `filled` from POST body and make `status` non-optional
  * [X] Make `status` not nullable on the db
* [X] Inform frontend team that the work is done
title: Job Fill Modal (Close/Delete Posting)

description:
## **Background/Summary:**

Two problems we want to solve:

1. Our tests manually close the features modal every time, so it'd be nice if the feature modals didn't show up in the tests
2. Whenever there's a new feature for employers, seekers will see the *same* new features pop up again on their browser. We should have independent datetimes for seekers and employers to account for different times we ship new seeker features vs. new employer features.

## **Deliverables:**

* Feature modals do not show on E2E tests
* Separate date times to trigger the seeker vs. employer modals
title: Feature Modal Improvements

description:
## **Background/Summary:**

We need more dataz around why employers are closing their job. It's pretty minimal right now. 

[Mock](https://www.figma.com/file/ZPbLshI7fBlnFt9UJB5dVi/Web-Design-Edits?type=design&node-id=0-1&mode=design&t=smUgH68XtZSWa5Ve-0)

## **Details:**

**For closing a Job Posting:**

* For closing a job posting, we'll be re-using the same endpoint from before: `/company/{company_id}/job-fill-metric`.
* The endpoint will be augmented to handle multiple codes.
* The codes the backend team will use in the backend for the fill `status` will be `hired-rb`, `hired-other`, and `not-hired`
* The status codes are going to be in a taxonomy table, so you can generate dynamically in the modals, if you would like.

**For when a company cancels:**

* Hit the same endpoint as before: `/company/{company_id}/cancel/{plan_code}`
* Send in the same kind of status codes as above.

## **Tests:**

Integration test that verifies the following:

* On Close button click, a modal shows up on the page
* On Cancel link click on the pricing page, a modal shows up on the page
* When modal(s) are filled out and Finish button is clicked, a network request is sent with the data that we expect.

## **Follow-up:**

Tell Aaron, post on Product General

## **Deliverables:**

* Improved modal when job postings are closed
* Modal shows up upon cancel link clicked
title: Improved Job Closure Modal

description:
**Background/Summary:**

In order to automatically find candidates for a job posting, we want to search the profiles index using a cleaned job title and the top skills necessary for the job. We can achieve both of these things cheaply using OpenAI's GPT models.

**Details:**

* [ ] Add a `posting_parses` table with `parses` column with `clean_title` , `parsed_skills` JSON props; also create `created_at`, and `updated_at` columns
* [ ] Modify `addPosting()` and `updatePosting()` to clean the title and parse the skills (if they have changed in the case of an update)
  * [ ] Use GPT to clean the title and parse the top ten skills. These prompts were effective in testing:
    * `You are a helpful HR assistant who reads job postings and finds the top skills necessary to do that job. You will only output the results in a JSON format as follows {skills: ['skill1', 'skill2', ...]}`
    * `You are a helpful HR assistant who looks at job titles and removes job types (like full-time part-time, etc) and locations (like Portland, OR) from the job title in a job posting. Output just the cleaned job title in JSON format as follows {clean_title: 'cleaned title here'}`
    * [ ] Wrap in try/catch; ignore failures, but notify in Honeybadger
* [ ] Add an endpoint to retrieve the cleaned title and parsed skills: `GET /company/{company_id}/candidate/search-terms`
  * [ ] Check if parsed data exists; if not, parse the data and then return

**Tests:**

* [ ] Test endpoint

**Follow-up:**

* [ ] Post in product general that you are done (tag Kenny)
title: Parse Job Posting

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Various styling fixes that engineers/CS/product has found that slipped through the cracks.

**Details:**

* Make the calendly modal not cut off on mobile
* Purchase button is too wide on already purchased packages. We need to make them shorter and less jarring.

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/764a6ad5-d202-4b43-9c25-5ea574898f17/b79cef6e-3de4-4912-9ac9-93fbe633cf32)

* Purchase buttons aren't sending in analytics events. They should be. Swap out `<button>` for `<Button>` and fix any styling to make it look like the button before.
* Button text not visible on delete email template confirmation. It should always be visible even when you're not hovering
