description:
**Background/Summary:**

It is possible for anyone to create an employer user on any company if they know that company's `company_id`.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create an employer account
2. Add a second user to the account
3. Open the network tab and edit the body of the `POST /employer-user` request. Change `company_id` to the ID of the company you want to get into. Modify email. Send.
4. Log into second company's account using modified email address.

**Details:**

* [X] Modify `POST /employer-user` endpoint to only allow `email` and `password` in the body. 
  * This endpoint is used to create the initial employer user
* [X] Create a new `POST /company/{company_id}/employer-user` endpoint that will be used to add users to a particular company
* [X] Make sure the PATCH for employer users cannot change the company_id
* [X] Swap out the endpoint that the frontend is using

**Tests:**

* [X] Modify tests as necessary
* [X] Test the new endpoint

**Deliverables:**

* [ ] A securer website
title: Gaping Security Hole: /employer-user

description:
**Background/Summary:**

***Prelude***

*Junior dev*: 

hey I'm going to make this form that sends to an endpoint when finished

```
<form onSubmit={handleSubmit((data) => Proxy.post('/data', data))}>
  <button type="submit />
</form>
```

*Screen:*

```
Invalid JSON: Unexpected I at position 0
```

*What backend actually sent:*

```
I'm a teapot
```

*Junior dev:* 

Oh no! *sobs inconsolably*

*Narrator:*

How do we fix this? With‚Ä¶ `checkJson`

**Details:**

Write this function:

```
export const checkJson = (resp): unknown => {
    try {
        return resp.json();
    } catch (e) {
        throw new Error(`Expected response body to be a JSON object:\n\n${resp.body}`);
    }
};
```

then,`resp.json() -> checkJson(resp)`

It's that simple!

Also add a type to `resp`

**Tests:**

Test that the following cases get handled:

* Mocked request that returns JSON sent to checkJson returns ‚Ä¶ JSON
* Mocked request that returns Error sent to checkJson throws Error *with descriptive message.*

**Deliverables:**

Less inconsolable sobbing
title: checkJson

description:
**Background/Summary:**

End to end tests are flaky. Integration tests are gooder. 

**Details:**

We want to add **two new tests** to replace the `search.spec.ts` test. 

* [ ] New api test for `src/utils/search.ts` that calls the `get` function and hits qa (not local). 
  * [ ] For this one, you will need to mock some environment variables so that it hits qa instead of your local typesense cluster. (To make sure you did it right, run the tests while your local docker is not running).
  * [ ] Assert that the request succeeds, and the data is the shape we expect
* [ ] New integration test for `src/components/organisms/InstantJobSearch.tsx` (This *could* get weird because we have never tested an InstantSearch component before)
  * [ ] Should type in a search query, hit search and expect a network request to be sent to the typesense url. Mock the response data.
  * [ ] *Try* testing the filter dropdowns.
    * [ ] We have had trouble testing react-select in the past, so give it a shot but don't let these cause too much scope-creep. They aren't tested in the E2E test, so we aren't losing anything if this doesn't happen.
      * [ ] Try using the `user-event`library for clicking, instead of `fireEvent`. React-select has weird inputs that aren't normal.
      * [ ] Get the options by the text they contain, not by test id because react select doesn't have test-id props. 
    * [ ] If you do get this to work, assert that the new network request that gets sent has the appropriate query params.
  * [ ] Expect the component to render the returned data correctly.

**Deliverables:**

Search end to end test is dead.
title: Search tests

**Details:**

description:
**Background/Summary:**

There is a DoS vulnerability in our site due to the Blowfish (Bcrypt) hashing algorithm. The hash string metadata tells Bcrypt how many hashing rounds to run. By increasing the number of rounds, a malicious user could cause our resources to be used up in running the Blowfish algorithm.

The solution to this vulnerability is to always send the plaintext password to the backend and do all hashing/comparing there.

**Details:**

* [X] Find all cases where we are hashing on the frontend
  * [X] Change the endpoints to accept plaintext passwords instead of a hash
  * [X] Make changes to frontend code to always send plaintext password to backend

Note that this will be a timed release with backend. 

**Tests:**

* [X] Update tests as necessary

**Deliverables:**

* [X] Eliminated DoS vulnerability
title: Blowfish hash vulnerability

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We are sending a lot of unnecessary network requests from the frontend api to the backend, and also from the frontend client to the server, particularly when pulling employer details. In the `pullEmployerUserInformation` function in `src/utils/auth.ts`, we send four separate requests to get employerUserDetails, packages, companyDetails, and whether they have freedom academy. Each one of those is awaited, running in series.

**Details:**

* Modify the `pullEmployerUserInformation` and `getEmployerUserDetails` functions to only pull the details needed by a specific call. Try using [getter](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Functions/get) functions maybe? 
  * Change all the requests to use a `Promise.all()` so that they run in parallel instead of in series.
* Modify the application page so that we don't send a new network request after every single keystroke when typing a cover letter
* We are sending 6 proxy requests to the profile status endpoint when you open the homepage as a seeker.

**Tests:**

Before the issue, monitor how long page loads take both locally and on prod. Compare this with after and see how much time we are saving. 

**Deliverables:**

***SPEED***
title: (NOT READY) Network efficiency

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Fastify is using AJV which by default coerces types and strips additional properties while validating. We stand to improve frontend usage of the backend api by increasing the strictness of validation, and likely uncover some bugs too.

See the notes section on fastify: [https://github.com/seriousme/fastify-openapi-glue#notes](https://github.com/seriousme/fastify-openapi-glue#notes)

Also see the validation documentation here: [https://fastify.dev/docs/latest/Reference/Validation-and-Serialization/](https://fastify.dev/docs/latest/Reference/Validation-and-Serialization/)

**Details:**

This type of card is ugly and has no value to the user. We should filter these out so that users the results don't look bad on page load. 

**Details:**

We **don't** want to filter them out of the results after the data fetching like we do with the hidden results, because that would mess up pagination and just be strange. 

Filtering this in the typesense query is going to be tricky (or impossible?) because of how typesense string array fields work. 

Idea #1: head bash typesense until you figure out how to filter to only search results which have at least one of the fields populated.

Idea #2: since these really only ever show up on the initial page load, we could just have a default sort_by which puts populated profiles at the top.
title: Hide empty profiles

The premium team would like templates added to all current premium customers so they can easily send emails. This is a one-off insert ‚Äî we are not building these templates into the tool.

**Details:**

Write a script that adds the templates to premium customers

Templates:

```
Subject: Thank you for applying!
Hello {{first_name}}!

Thank you for your application to {{position}}! RedBalloon is working with {{business_name}} to interview candidates for this role.

After looking over your application, we've decided not to move forward with your candidacy at this time. We will reach out if anything changes or if a position opens up that would be a better fit for you.

We're super grateful for your interest in the mission of {{business_name}}.

All the best,

----------------
Subject: Can we schedule an interview?
Hello {{first_name}}!

Thanks for applying to the position at {{business_name}}. We are working with the team to interview candidates for this role. I was interested in your background and experience and would love to schedule an initial interview to kick things off.

Please schedule a 30-minute interview time that works well for you. INSERT INTERVIEW LINK

All the best,

----------------
Subject: Thank you!
Thank you so much for your application to our position at Company Name! It was great getting to know you during the interview process. I appreciate the time you took to meet with me.

At this time, we've decided to move forward with other candidates. We will reach out if anything changes or if a position opens up that would be a fit for you. Feel free to apply to any future positions for which you are qualified.

We're super grateful for your interest in and support of the work we're doing at COMPANY NAME.

All the best,
```

Ask Ruth about preferred template names and whether or not to add anything after the `All the best,` or leave that to be filled in.

**Background/Summary:**

Right now tokens are support in applicant messages but not talent messages. We want to be able to send tokenized email templates in talent messages, as well.

**Details:**

This is the code in `addApplicantMessage()`:

```
const tokenMap: TokenMap = {
            first_name: seeker.first_name ?? '',
            last_name: seeker.last_name ?? '',
            business_name: applicant.business_name,
            position: applicant.job_title ?? '',
        };

        const parsed_subject = replaceTokens(req.body.subject, tokenMap);
        const parsed_body = replaceTokens(req.body.body, tokenMap);
```

* Add similar code to `addTalentMessage()`
  * There won't by a `position` in talent messages, since they are not tied to a particular job

**Tests:**

* `replaceTokens` is already unit tested


* update talent message tests to test tokens

**Follow-up:**

* Let the frontend team know when this is done

**Deliverables:**

* We can tokenize talent messages
title: Add tokenization to talent messages

description:
**Background/Summary:**

References:

* [https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/transaction-iso.html](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/transaction-iso.html)
* [https://knexjs.org/guide/transactions.html](https://knexjs.org/guide/transactions.html)

We are trying to use transactions to prevent race conditions, but we are not using them correctly. In order to have the functionality we might expect from a transaction, we need to wrap them in retry functionality in case of a serialization failure.

**Details:**

* [X] Write a small test case that produces a serialization error so we can reliably catch and retry the logic. The postgres link above has an example we could try.
* [X] Write a helper function that can wrap a transaction in retry logic.
* [X] Find all the places labeled `TODO (RB-665)` and swap in the retry function
  * [X] employer dao
    * [X] upsertProfile
    * [X] policeCreditBalance: either change the logic to not use consume credits, or wrap the transaction

**Tests:**

* [X] ~If your test case that produces a serialization error is reliable enough, add it as an integration test.~
* [X] write tests for modified logic as necessary

**Follow-up:**

* [X] Communicate your findings to the team.

**Deliverables:**

Better understanding and usage of transactions
title: Serializable Transactions

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Modify our ErrorBoundary component to allow an optional fallback prop. If this is provided, it should render the fallback on an error. This will allow us to have more granular error boundaries, so that if one component fails, it doesn't crash the whole page. This should not affect the behavior of our current calls to ErrorBoundary.

**Details:**

I was able to get it ~partially~ working by changing the return in the error case to this:

```
this.props.fallback || (<ErrorPage message="Whoops! Looks like something went wrong. " />));
```

Also make sure that if we are displaying the fallback, we don't show the react popup with the `Unhandled Error` message.

After this is complete, all suspended components going forward should have an ErrorBoundary which will detect if the network request fails.
title: Error Boundary refactor

description:
**Background/Summary:**

For the history of RedBalloon's software, we always assume things are successful and there's nothing that goes wrong. But things can go wrong. So that's a problem. We should handle things when it goes wrong. 

The reason this came up is with password resets. Whenever the user requests a password reset link, but then doesn't actually get around to clicking the link in their email until days later, the password reset expired. When they enter their new password, they need to be notified somehow that their password reset hash was out of date. 

**Details:**

In general, we do NOT want to automatically assume every fetch returns json, because some of them return strings.

In the 4 different service files, (sparky, api, testimony and proxy) we have to change the behavior of how the fetching works. Within every single function call, before the final `.then(res => res.json())`, we should first check the status of the response and, if the status is `>=400`, then throw an error with the response as the value (e.g. `throw new Error(res);`). This should happen for every helper function. If the status is not over 400, then we can assume it's valid and we can return `res.json()` like normal.

**Tests:**

No tests needed, there shouldn't be any change in functionality, just a change behind the scenes. 

**Deliverables:**

* All service files are correctly checking the status code, and if there's anything that doesn't return successful, then throw an error which we can then correctly handle in the calling function.
title: (NOT READY) Actually look at status codes

**Background/Summary:**

Currently if an employer who has not yet registered is on the employer info page and wants to buy a package, these are the steps they must take.

1) employer-info (select a package) 

2) create account

3) purchase now (select a package again)

4) payment page

We want to cut out step 3 and just redirect them from account creation straight to the purchase page for the package they have already selected. (Which we are already storing in the query)

**Details:**

This will involve messing with the `getButtonJsx`function in `src/hooks/usePurchaseNowPackages.tsx` to add a `redirectTo` query param. 

**Tests:**

Manually make sure that redirects happen as intended, also make sure to not introduce any unintended redirects. Any helper functions should be unit tested

**Follow-up:**

Tell Aaron once this is shipped
title: Purchase page redirect

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Right now, we are never showing the ENTREPRENEUR package on the `employer-info` page, regardless of whether you are logged in as an employer or not

**Details:**

* Update the `getPackagesToShow` function.
  * Modify the check to only check:
    * Does the user have the Standard or Plus package
  * If the user is does not have the `Standard` or the `Plus` package show the `ENTREPRENEUR` package
* There is currently a bug on prod, where if you got to the `purchase-now` page and refresh the page, the site will crash because we are using a React `Portal` to put the modal on the `document.body`
  * The reason the site is crashing is because `document` does not exist because the component is not a purely client side component
  * This can be easily fixed by dynamically importing the component where it is used
    * dynamically import `PurchaseNowPackages` on the `PackagePage`

**Tests:**

* The `getPackagesToShow` function does have a test, make sure to modify the test to 

**Deliverables:**

* Modify the `getPackagesToShow` to always show the entrepreneur package except if the employer is currently paying for the standard package or the plus package
  * Do this for `employer-info`
  * Do this for `purchase-now`
  * Do this for `employers` (the employer homepage)
* Fix the bug on the `purchase-now` page
title: Always show ENTREPRENEUR except for paying employers

**Background/Summary:**

This is a follow up to a conversation about the proper way to deal with data fetching. This issue is to implement a new way of structuring our fetches which would make us closer to the /app directory way of doing things.

**Details:**

All network requests should be handled by individual components (or their hooks) rather than having the parent get all of the data and pass it down to the children. Use the `cache` react function to dedupe requests as necessary, but also make sure to invalidate the cache when we know data is stale. 

Have a dummy component in the talent network page which also hits the talent endpoint so that we can verify caching works properly.

Optional: use the `use` react hook to instead of `suspendPromise`.

**Background/Summary:**

Employers started noticing that after they send a message the entire site 500'ed. The reason for this was when we redirected the user back to the applicant page, the message activity section was trying to create a date off of `undefined`, because the property of data that had the date for applications was `sent_datetime` and the property for the talent network profile was `created_at`, and we were trying to re-use the same component for each. So we fixed that and things should be back to normal now.

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We use similar functionality in three places for retrieving talent details, and the queries are somewhat slow, even for a single seeker. We can do better by creating a single abstracted helper function that runs fewer queries.

**Details:**

* [X] Abstract the seeker details functionality from:
  * [X] getTalentProfile
  * [X] unlockSeekerProfile
  * [X] operatorUnlockSeekerProfile
* [ ] Write a new helper function that pulls data in batches (eg: pull all experiences for all the passed seeker_ids in one query)
  * [X] The queries for experience and education do not need to return priority or detail ids or additional details
  * [X] Most of the queries currently being run are in helper functions (getEducationDetails, getExperienceDetails, getSkillsDetails, getSocialMedia) that are only used in one other place. It is likely worth modifying the existing helper function rather than writing a new one.

**Tests:**

* [ ] Tests should already be in place, so fix anything that fails in an expected way, or update tests for anything that should have failed but didn't.

**Follow-up:**

* [ ] Check timings before/after for pulling batches of talent details. Ideally, we get below 1s for a full batch of details for 25 seekers.

**Deliverables:**

Snappier experience for talent profile search.
title: Speed up talent details #2

```
{"success":true,"remaining":98,"response_code":"100"}

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We've been fighting hard to get integration tests to become the norm for components that we create. But it's proven harder than we originally anticipated, especially with components that use Suspense. Time to make things feasible with components that have Suspense

**Details:**

Part 1: Research/prototype out a throwaway component that utilizes suspense. Have it do at least some of the following things: (1) pull data when it loads with a network fetch via Suspense, and (2) sends a POST request when you submit a form. The integration tests should be able to verify each of those two states happened

Part 2: With the knowledge gained from above, we should de-mystify why it was so hard to test out the profile search/talent network tables. For things 

**Tests:**

Ideally the E2E test for profile search is re-coded into several, small integration tests. Simple use cases to test for, for starters:

* Searching shows up results
* Clicking unlock shows unlock modal, card is replaced with real data

**Deliverables:**

* E2E test is re-coded into several smaller integration tests for Profile Search, or if not proven feasible, then follow-up issues to refactor out parts of the E2E test into integration tests
* Learning meeting for the whole frontend team on the "proper" way to do integration tests
title: Get react integration tests working fo real

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We're switching off of backblaze because it's been proven more for archiving rather than actual object storage. We've decided to switch to Cloudflare storage instead. To make this switch over, the first step is refactoring our code to utilize an S3-compatible sdk, but still keep uploading to backblaze. 

**Details:**

Anywhere that has `new b2` in the frontend code base needs to be swapped out for s3-compatible code. We should theoretically not have to have the `backblaze-b2` package in our codebase after this issue.

**Tests:**

Test the following things:

1. Resumes/photo uploads for seekers and photo uploads for employers work
2. When an error occurs, it doesn't crash the page.

**Deliverables:**

No more `backblaze-b2` package in our code base.
title: Change out B2 code to be S3 compatible

description:
**Background/Summary:**

<Sufficient context to understand why we are doing this‚Ä¶>

Currently, all internal/local services have to send emails through Hubspot's SMTP server because we don't have anything else. This means that all links are proxied through Hubspot and if we ever decide to not do transactional emails through Hubspot, the SMTP server is going to have to be changed in several services.

It would be better to be in control of our own SMTP server for the internal services.

**Details:**

* A new Fly App will need to be created with a dedicated IP address OR run docker container on Colby
  * Enable smtp.redballoon.dev cert and DNS
* Use [https://github.com/bokysan/docker-postfix](https://github.com/bokysan/docker-postfix)
* Figure out the correct config options
* Make sure to enable SPF and DKIM so our emails aren't marked as spam
  * DNS change for SPF
  * Create DKIM key and register it in DNS
* Change services to the new SMTP server
  * Metabase
  * Gitlab
  * Colby alerts

**Deliverables:**

* Working SMTP server with SPF and DKIM
* Internal services connected to SMTP server
title: Setup SMTP Server for local services

description:

The resume screening and interview processes will allow the reviewer to score the applicant on different categories. We need to be able to both get the current state of these scores and update each score.

**Details:**

Add `screening_criteria`, `screening_score`, and `interview_score` tables:

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/c9c4a18d-8c80-46f8-86a5-6890b5af47ba/01d8a848-51b2-4c76-9abe-c4b212bef57c)

`PUT /ats/{company_id}/score/{application_id}`

Request body:

```
{
  type: 'screening',
  employer_user: 1, 
  criteria: 'experience', 
  score: 4
}
```

`GET /ats/{company_id}/scores/{application_id}`

Note: should return all criteria of specified type, not just criteria that have been scored.

Query params:

* type \[screening | interview\]

Response:

```
[
  {
    criteria: 'experience', 
    employer_user: 'Steve Bremer', 
    score: 4, 
  }, 
  {
    criteria: 'skills',
    ...
  }
]
```

**Tests:**

* Add tests for both endpoints
title: Screening/interview score endpoints

description:
**Background/Summary:**

When users cancel, they shouldn't have access to their applicants or talent network from before, unless they buy a package again.

**Details:**

We are ALWAYS going to show the link to profile search.

We are going to put a message on the applications table saying the customer needs a package to see the applications table. (See the `Applications Table - Not a paying customer` section in mock)

We are going to show a similar message for the talent network page. (See the `Talent Network - Not a paying customer` section in the mock)

When the employer has cancelled a package, and searches in profile search, we CANNOT reveal any unlocked cards. Instead, we will show a message describing what happened. (See `Profile Search - employer cancelled package but searches for previously unlocked job seeker` section in the mock).

Utilize `isPayingCustomer()` to figure out if the user is paying or not. 

**Deliverables:**

Profile search does not reveal previously unlocked job seekers if they cancelled their package.

App table & Talent Network table pages are not showing if customer isn't paying for a package.
title: Handle cancellation state

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We are giving seekers the functionality to allow them to upload multiple resumes. This is the issue that does *all* of it. 

**Details:**

I decided to not split this out because of context and dev moding would get really weird. Mock is attached.

This issue will have a few things needed to be done:

* Changing Seeker Profile
  * *Do not do a massive refactor of Seeker Profile. I know it is tempting.*
  * Make the reducer handle multiple resumes
  * ~Instead of looking in attachments to find the resume, display all attachments with a resume~
  * Instead of `CHANGE_RESUME`, we should implement `ADD_RESUME`, `MAKE_RESUME_DEFAULT`, and `DELETE_RESUME`
  * Check for `default` in the resume to see if it is default or not
  * Change a resume to default by using: `/seeker/{seeker_id}/attachment/{attachment_id}/default`
  * ~If someone adds their first resume, mark it as default.~
* Changing the Apply Page
  * Display the resume attachment in our newfangled Dropdown component.
  * Make sure to include the uploaded date.
  * Hide the dropdown when the seeker has no resumes
  * Send in the resume id into `/seeker/{seeker_id}/application`
* Changing Public Profile
  * Luckily, if you *just* change the `getResume` function to get the default resume, then everything will work.
  * ‚Ä¶except for on `/employer/application`
  * ‚Ä¶on `/employer/application/` we want to get the specific resume from the application, not the default one.
* ~Changing New Seeker Resume~
  * ~We need to also set the resume to default here~

**Tests:**

Test any new API stuff you happen to make for some reason

**Follow-up:**

Tell everyone once it ships

**Deliverables:**

Multiple resumes
title: Multiple Resumes

description:
**Background/Summary:**

If a user likes one of the default email templates that we give them access too, but wants to tweak just a few things, we do not want them to have to create a whole new template. Instead, we can add an option for them to duplicate a template so that they can create a new template and have a base line template to go off of.

**Details:**

* Add another column to the email template table with the option to duplicate the template
  * This will create the new template and open up the modal with everything filled out from the template it was duplicated from.
    * Use `/company/{company_id}/template`with the `POST` method
  * Then you can save the template in the modal
    * Use `/company/{company_id}/template/{template_id}` with the `PATCH` method

**Deliverables:**

* Add the functionality for a user to duplicate a template
title: Duplicate Template Option

**Background/Summary:**

We want to add an opt-out flag for job seekers who do not want to show up in profile searches. The user won't be able to set this flag themselves, but if they contact the CS team, we can set it for them.

**Details:**

* Modify the `seeker_details` table to add an opt-out flag
* Modify the `upsertProfileSearch()` to not add any profile data to the search index if the opt-out flag is set
* Add an endpoint to update the flag
  * should call `upsertProfileSearch()` in order to add/remove the profile data

**Tests:**

* Verify that toggling the flag has the effect of adding/removing profile data from search index

**Follow-up:**

* Communicate to CS team that the opt-out flag exists
* Write operator frontend issue (or just do it)

**Deliverables:**

* Seekers can opt out of appearing in profile searches
title: Add opt-out flag for seeker profile search

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Duplicate attachment records are getting into our database, but it doesn't make sense because there can only be one file per download_url. 

Updating the timestamp is better than returning a 409 because the frontend will have already overwritten the file in cloud storage and are simply telling us that they did it so we can log it in the db. 

**Details:**

* [X] Change the addSeekerAttachment and addEmployerAttachment to update upload_datetime instead of creating a new db record
* [X] Test it out and get it merged
* [X] Remove all the existing duplicate db records. Keep the most recent of each.

```
select array_agg(id), count(*) from seeker_attachments group by download_url having count(*) > 1
```

**Tests:**

* [X] Add an integration test for employer attachment and seeker attachment

**Deliverables:**

A prerequisite for displaying multiple resumes is preventing duplicate row from being in the database for a single resume.
title: Cleanup Duplicate Attachments

**Deliverables:**

Unblock some of the fundamental features in multiple resumes.

description:
**Background/Summary:**

While working on [RB-472](https://linear.app/redballoon/issue/RB-472/sparrow-download-use-updated-at), we noticed that quite a few tables were missing timestamp fields that should (reasonably) be present.

**Details:**

* Should have an `updated_at` field
  * company_details
  * company_profile
  * employer_user
  * job_alerts
  * operator_user
  * screening_questions
  * seeker_details
* Should have a `created_at`field
  * company_profile
  * screening_questions
* Should have `archived`changed from a boolean to a timestamp `archived_at`on applicant_messages

All of these changes should be done in a single knex migration with accompanying code changes to fill in the fields whenever a row is updated/created. Removing the `archived` field is the exception, which should be done in a second migration so we don't have any downtime, if we're concerned about it.

**Deliverables:**

Adding timestamp fields to the db for better ability to track user activity.
title: Add missing timestamp fields

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We need to create an email scheduler so that employers can send delayed emails to candidates (probably for rejection). The scheduler can run in the Data Pulls repository. Instead of immediately sending emails, they are added to the database and the scheduler check a timestamp to determine if they should be sent.

**Details:**

* [X] Modify `applicant_messages` table to make `sent_datetime` nullable and remove the `now()` default
  * [X] If we can easily change the column name to `sent_at`, then do so
* [X] Add `scheduled_emails` table
  * [X] table_name TEXT
  * [X] message_id BIGINT
  * [X] msg_egg JSONB
  * [X] send_at TIMESTAMP
* [X] Modify `sendEmail()`to take optional `send_at` argument
  * [X] If `send_at` is undefined, then send the transactional email: `await hubspotClient.marketing.transactional.singleSendApi.sendEmail(msgEgg);`
  * [X] If `send_at` is defined, then write the `msgEgg` to `scheduled_emails` table for sending by the scheduled email job
* [X] Create a schedule email endpoint
  * [X] Should send any email on the table and then remove it
  * [X] Update `sent_at` on the appropriate table
  * [X] Do the send and delete operations in a transaction, so that the row is not deleted if the message fails to send
* [X] Make scheduled email job run every hour (or whatever the minimum delay will be)
* [X] Modify the applicant message endpoint to take the new params
* [X] Write an endpoint to cancel a pending email
* [X] Modify the frontend code to use `sent_at`

**Tests:**

* [X] delete of future message deletes from both tables
* [X] applicant and talent messages still work
* [X] sendScheduledEmails works and fails as expected
  * [X] 401
  * [X] success true
  * [X] success false
  * [X] failed messages remain in db
  * [X] sent messages get deleted from queue
  * [X] future messages remain in db
* [X] mail unittests pass
* [X] up and down migrations work
* [X] hand test 502s with hubspot again
* [X] ensure sendEmail doesn't send if do_send is false

**Follow-up:**

None

**Deliverables:**

Ability to delay email send
title: Scheduled Email

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We will be allowing seekers to have multiple resumes. One of them will be designated as a default resume, which the frontend will use to determine which resume to use as default on the applications page.

**Details:**

* Add a `default` boolean column to the seeker_attachments table. 
* Modify `addSeekerAttachment()` and `addAttachment()`in the seeker-dao to take `default` as an argument.
  * If `default` is set, it should unset the current default resume
  * needs to be backward compatible
  * mark first resume as default
* Add a `PATCH /seeker/{seeker_id}/attachment/{attachment_id}/default` endpoint
  * endpoint should unset current default resume
  * attempting to set default for a photo should return an error
* Modify `getSeekerAttachments()` to return the default column
* Modify `upsertProfileSearch()` to add default resume text to the search index

**Tests:**

* Verify we don't end up with multiple default resumes
* Verify we can't end up with no default resume

Follow-up:

* Write issues to clean up anything left that is backwards compatible

**Deliverables:**

Endpoint and logic support for default resume
title: Add default resume support

description:
**Background/Summary:**

If you go to the applications table via a particular job, it filters all the applications down to that particular job. However, if you select anything from the applicant status drop-down, then it no longer filters on just the job (i.e., you will see applicants for any job).

For example, this shows the table filtered on a single job:

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/137b7250-d0cb-4f0e-b53a-746eca082387/7aed70bf-a395-4381-83fc-0d18f5f5b3ae)

This is the same page after selecting *New Applicants* from the status drop-down. Notice that the page is no longer filtering down to just the Product Owner job title.

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/5bf5bf18-3644-4dc0-a801-3473ca5ee0d0/9fbaf764-c9ac-48db-a2f7-1e494f49206b)

**Details:**

Changing the status should filter with respect to the posting that you are filtering down to. Most likely need to pass a posting id to the `useApplicationsTable()` hook.

**Deliverables:**

Status dropdown works with respect to the filtered posting id
title: Applications table filter bug

description: Separate sales/cs phone numbers
title: Contact Page Tweaks

description:
**Background/Summary:**

[Here](https://app.mezmo.com/0a64634bf8/logs/view?q=seeker%2F49624%2Fattachment&t=06%2F20%2007%3A46%3A00&apps=rb-db,rb-backend2) is an example of when a user uploaded his resume (seeker id \`49624\`), and for some reason it sent duplicate requests to the backend. Most likely this is a double click problem? Whatever the case, our network requests should be wrapped so that the button which sends it is inactive while a request is happening.

**Details:**

Try to duplicate whatever happened here. The fix will probably involve making a button inactive while a network request is in progress, or only allowing one request total.  

**Example:**

This guy uploaded his resume, then five seconds later another duplicate request was sent. This caused a race condition in the backend. This user still got a resume uploaded just fine, but we generally want to not send duplicate requests.

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/4fa7144e-ce55-4d10-ae3b-6016a6909b93/0ee74cd2-0851-40e8-b37d-f8381948ed28)

**Tests:**

<What tests need to be added‚Ä¶>

**Follow-up:**

<Write issues, communicate, etc...>

**Deliverables:**

<One line description of the primary objective...>
title: Duplicate network requests

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Basically we don't have any history for the ProfileSearch page, so if you jump from the profile search page to the applicants table or the talent network table, you will lose everything that you had stored. To fix this, we can add our filters to the URL

**Details:**

Essentially we will still use the ProfileSearchReducer, but when you actually submit the form to make the search, then it will publish the reducer state to the url. Then when we jump between pages, we can remember what the previous query was and the use can have their history if they had a massive amount of filters selected. 

We will need to initialize the users last search when they jump back to the page

**Tests:**

* Write small functions for populating and retrieving the query params from the url and make unit tests for them. 

**Follow-up:**

<Write issues, communicate, etc...>

**Deliverables:**

* Store filters in the URL for the ProfileSearch
* Initialize the query params filters when navigating to the `profile-search` page
title: Store filters as URL query params

description:
**Background/Summary:**

A wise man once said, "A greppable codebase is a good codebase". 

When it comes to making requests to the backend, we should seek to make it as easy as possible to find ALL occurrences of a network request as easily as possible. The simplest way to allow this is a simple copy+paste of the endpoint from backend, and global searching it in the frontend.

**Details:**

As our API wrappers are becoming the go-to for network requests, we need to be able to make the endpoints they're hitting super obvious, regardless of whether you're using it in server side props or the browser. 

Make every method in the class function have the *direct*, literal string instead of an awkwardly concatenated string. E.g. 

Do this:

`const endpoint = '/talent/{company_id}/forward';` 

and *not* this:

 `const endpoint = this.baseUrl + "/" + this.companyId + "/forward"`

Do this for `CompanyApi`, `SeekerApi`, `TalentApi`, and `GeneralApi`.

The  `buildUrl()` method should be in the parent `Api` class that automatically substitutes in your variables. All path name variables should be passed in via the `options` object in the constructor. 

The `buildUrl()` function should be smart enough to know whether it *has* to substitute in a particular id based on whether the code is running on the server or the browser. You should *not* have to substitute in any kind of param. 

Remove all instances of `service` getting passed to the constructor. 

**Deliverables:**

* API Wrapper classes updated to utilize `buildUrl()` 
* No need for `service` param in constructor
title: API wrapper improvements

description:
**Background/Summary:**

It's difficult to right click ‚Üí inspect the html in our tool and figure out what component is getting rendered. 

**Details:**

At the root of every component, we need a `data-component` attribute, that is a string of the component name. That way, engineers know directly in the html what component they're looking at. 

However, to prevent engineers from forgetting to add a `data-component` attribute, we should have a pre-commit hook that denies engineers from doing a commit if one of the changed files is a component file and it doesn't have `data-component`. 

Add the check to `.husky/pre-commit` 

**Deliverables:**

* `data-component` added to all components in `src/components`
* pre-commit hook that reject a commit if a component file is modified and there's no `data-component` attribute contained in the file.
title: Add data-component attribute to all components

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Right now we run unit tests on the git pre-push hook. This should run in CI because of the following benefits:

1. You don't have to worry about making sure the VPN is setup on your laptop when you're working outside the office
2. If you have a slower computer it won't take as long to do a git push
3. When the backend guys deploy code, they run our integration tests, which ensures the frontend is in-sync with the backend.

**Details:**

Remove git `.pre_push` hook

Add in a stage before deploy review app that runs all of our unit tests. `yarn test:jest` would be the comment.

Make a new CI runner with the `bash` tag (talk with Jonathan)

**Deliverables:**

Unit tests are running in CI
title: Move unit tests into CI

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Currently, we are far too optimistic on all of our network requests. We simply send the request, assume that it will be a 200, and then await the `res.json()`. If anything goes wrong, this crashes hard and gives a very strange error message. We want to add a `.catch()`to all our fetchers (proxy, sparky, api). We also want to detect the status code and check a status code that's less than `400`, instead of returning blindly. 

**Details:**

If anything does go wrong in a request, we should log to Honeybadger and return null. Returning null might cause errors in some pages (eg if we expect the response object to have a specific field), but that is ok because those spots will already be broken. Just be sure to not introduce new problems.

Remember to pass on the status code to the frontend.

### Relevant files: 

`pages/api/proxy/index.ts`

`Sparky.ts`

`Api.ts`

*Our* frontend API endpoints.

**Tests:**

Make sure that the failures behave as we expect. (There should be helpful Honeybadger logs, and null data)

Make sure successful requests do not change their current behavior; you should **NOT** need to modify every single request in the entire codebase.

**Follow-up:**

<Write issues, communicate, etc...>

**Deliverables:**

Error logging for network requests, passing along the status code.
title: Check status codes

  ```
  { 
    password: process.env.IRON_SESSION_SECRET_COOKIE_PASSWORD ?? '',
    ttl: thirtyDaysInSeconds
  }
  ```
* Update the [template](https://app.hubspot.com/email/22622375/details/106623114382/performance) (and this [template](https://app.hubspot.com/email/22622375/details/114864448655/performance)) in HubSpot to include a note: *Note: this link will expire in 30 days.*
title: Forwarded applicant/talent link

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We need to better understand the options and opportunity cost of creating fail-over options for the various third party services we rely on. 

**Details:**

For each of our third party software services, research and write-up the following:

* Best alternatives
  * What are other services or strategies we can use to mitigate an outage (e.g., mirrored service in stand-by, 404 page, disabled feature, etc.)
* Rough LOE estimate to implement fail-over
  * What is the LOE cost (best guess) to implement each potential strategy
* Cost of no fail-over
  * What is the down time or outage impacts of maintaining status quo
* Cost of maintaining a fail-over (in $)
  * For example, if the fail-over strategy is another service provider, what is the dollar cost
* Devops cost of maintaining a fail-over (in LOE)
  * How much devops time (in LOE) will maintaining/testing the fail-over option cost

Third party services to research:

* Backblaze (object storage)
* Fly.io
* Hubspot
* Cloudflare
* Affinda

**Follow-up:**

* Send results to Steve

**Deliverables:**

* Written research results
title: Research Fail-over Options and Costs

description:
**Background/Summary:**

The TS refresh from prod to qa fails on the truncate step on the resumes index. The correct way to do this is not truncation, but rather creating a new index and swapping an alias (zero downtime). 

**Details:**

* [X] Temporarily modify the prod ‚Üí qa refresh script to create each collection with \`\_v1\`appended
* [X] Build an endpoint in the backend that can create a new ts collection and return the name with the version postfix incremented (it should pull the current collection name from the alias)
* [X] With minimal downtime, get aliases set up on QA:
  * [X] Drop all the unversioned collections
  * [X] Create an alias for each collection and point it at the new collections
* [X] Modify the refresh script to:
  * [X] call the endpoint to create new collections
  * [X] copy the prod data to the newly created collections
    * [X] export
    * [X] ~truncate~
    * [X] import
  * [X] swap the alias from the old collection to the new collection
  * [X] drop the old collection

**Tests:**

* [X] check the total number of documents against prod (it should be very close, if not identical)
* [X] double check the collection structures to make sure they match prod

**Follow-up:**

<Write issues, communicate, etc...>

**Deliverables:**

More reliable and flexible typescript refreshes on QA.
title: TS Aliases on QA

**Background/Summary:**

We need to add the capabilities for tagging users that come in with partners (for example, `/fox`) would tag the user that signs up with `fox` when they register

**Details:**

Employer partner tags are special in that when the user navigates to the partner tag endpoint, the site will redirect to the new `/employers` page, instead of just the regular homepage (at `/`)

Add a `getServerSideProps()` function to the component in `pages/[index]/index.tsx`, and within it make a request to the endpoint created in [RB-477](https://linear.app/redballoon/issue/RB-477/is-partner-tag-endpoint) . Pass through a `redirect_to` prop into the component and redirect to that instead of always redirecting to `/`. If the partner is an employer profile redirect to `/employers`, and if it's not then redirect to `/` like usual.

**Tests:**

API unit test for the endpoint

~E2E test that verifies redirecting correctly for normal partner tag vs. employer partner tag~

**Deliverables:**

Properly handle employer partner tags

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We would like operators to be able to create, update, and delete plans from the operator dashboard. We need to add the ability to update and delete.

**Details:**

`PATCH /operator/{operator_id}/plan/{plan_code}`

* The endpoint needs to check if the plan is already in use (i.e., added to a customer). 
  * If so, only the `plan_name` , `allowed_postings`, `description`, `plan_group`, and `package_credits` are editable; otherwise, any value other than the plan_code should be editable

`DELETE /operator/{operator_id}/plan/{plan_code}`

* The plan can only be deleted if it is not already in use

**Tests:**

* Can update plan
* Can't update amount_cents, for example, if plan is in use
* Can delete plan
* Cannot delete plan already in use
title: PATCH/DELETE plan endpoint

description:
**Background/Summary:**

In the backend, we have multiple ways of doing pagination, specifically with how we return the page count. Sometimes we return undefined, sometimes zero-based, sometimes one-based, and sometimes it appears we're doing a mix of both (one-based if max_results is not defined, zero-based if it is, but only if the resultset is empty).

**Details:**

We want to standardize on one-based page count, even if the result set is empty: there is one empty page.

* [X] Implement the standard everywhere we paginate (6 places?)
* [X] If there is an easy way to abstract, that may be worth it, but watch your LOE usage and don't let the issue balloon

**Tests:**

* [X] Write integration tests as if this standard was in place everywhere we paginate (five-ish places, since one or two may already be tested)
  * [X] Resolve `TODO (RB_476): test pagination` in /src/service/employer.spec.ts
  * [X] Add 400 error responses for bad query params 
* [X] Manual test in the frontend with a real data dump from prod

**Follow-up:**

Communicate to frontend so they know what the new standard is

**Deliverables:**

Clearer/standardized code for pagination resulting in a lower likelihood of bugs and easier maintenance
title: Standardize Pagination Page Count

description:
**Background/Summary:**

The sparrow download fails occasionally because the data is live updating while we are running the `\copy` command. 

**Details:**

Update the sparrow download shell script to diff the tables rather than doing a whole hog copy (we may need something more flexible than bash). We can use the updated_at (or similar) field to do this. 

A complication: Resume parses is the main problem, and it also doesn't have an updated_at field, so we have to pull the field out of the json.

At the end of each table transfer, the number of rows in the table should be identical. If they are not, redo the transfer after truncating the table.

**Follow-up:**

None.

**Deliverables:**

More reliable sparrow download to ballooner.
title: Sparrow download: use updated_at

description:
**Background/Summary:**

The 3 "pill" inputs are: 

* ~desired remote type (~`~desired_remote_types~` ~in TypeSense)~ *As of standup on June 6th, we are dropping this because there's barely any job seekers that have mentioned remote type*
* desired job types (`desired_job_types` in TypeSense)
* desired roles (`desired_roles` in TypeSense)

These 3 inputs are all similar, in that the user selects a "pill" to include it. The user can select multiple items.

### Latest Mock:

[https://www.figma.com/file/rDaiHVSQ9PvcGN06nAQxCM/RedBalloon---Profile-Search-(RedBalloon-Version)?type=design&node-id=237-4234&t=hc3W4bLVf5NfvfR4-0](https://www.figma.com/file/rDaiHVSQ9PvcGN06nAQxCM/RedBalloon---Profile-Search-(RedBalloon-Version)?type=design&node-id=237-4234&t=hc3W4bLVf5NfvfR4-0)

**Details:**

* Be sure to include "Unspecified" on each of these filters, to not subtly filter out users that never bothered to fill out their remote type
* ~Allow multiple items to be selected for these inputs~ sike don't do that
* Initialize these inputs by using the taxonomy calls we do for the create posting page (for example, `/taxonomy/remote_type`. 
* An example `filter_by` with data entered for all filters:

```
filter_by: "desired_remote_types:['not-remote','hybrid'] && desired_job_types:['full-time'] && desired_roles:['information-technology','design']"
```

**Tests:**

Select something for all 3 inputs, then click search, verify that the request sent out has the required 3 inputs to filter results, and the cards change.

**Deliverables:**

Filter modal contains "pill" inputs for
title: Filter Modal - Pill Inputs

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Remove any `DEV_MODE` checks we have for showing the Employer Profile page and Talent Network pages in the tool.

Manually try out QA and prod when you ship this!

DEV_MODE is removed

description:
**Background/Summary:**

There are situations where a job seeker applies to a job by an employer, and thus the employer shouldn't have to spend a credit to unlock them since they already are able to see all their contact info. BUT, sometimes employers get complete duds applying to their job and they don't want that job seeker to be part of their hand-curated Talent Network. Thus, we'll give them an "Add to Talent Network" button

### **Latest Mock:**

See the "Profile Search - Job Seeker Already Applied" section

[https://www.figma.com/file/rDaiHVSQ9PvcGN06nAQxCM/RedBalloon---Profile-Search-(RedBalloon-Version)?type=design&node-id=237-4234&t=z5OCte3k3yIQ7DVS-0](https://www.figma.com/file/rDaiHVSQ9PvcGN06nAQxCM/RedBalloon---Profile-Search-(RedBalloon-Version)?type=design&node-id=237-4234&t=z5OCte3k3yIQ7DVS-0)

**Details:**

Whenever the following attributes are true when you pull job seeker data in `/talent/{employer_user}/seekers/details`, then the seeker has already applied, but has NOT been added to the employers' talent network: 

```
"in_talent_network": false,
"unlocked": true,
```

If this is true, then instead of blurring out their photo and having the "Unlock" button, we have to instead show two buttons: (1) View Profile and (2) Add to Talent Network

If the button is clicked, you should hit `/talent/{employer_user}/status` and send in the new status of `uncontacted`

Also show "This seeker has already applied to one of your postings".

**Tests:**

Make sure a request gets sent out with `uncontacted` in the body when you click the "Add to Talent Network" button

Test the card shows up with the correct buttons when the seeker details passed in are in the various states:

* Unlocked
* Locked
* Unlocked but not in Talent Network

**Deliverables:**

"Add to Talent Network" button works
title: Add to Talent Network button

**Background/Summary:**

When users search for results, it'd be nice if they could sort the results to match what they're interested in. 

### **Latest Mock:**

[https://www.figma.com/file/rDaiHVSQ9PvcGN06nAQxCM/RedBalloon---Profile-Search-(RedBalloon-Version)?type=design&node-id=237-4234&t=z5OCte3k3yIQ7DVS-0](https://www.figma.com/file/rDaiHVSQ9PvcGN06nAQxCM/RedBalloon---Profile-Search-(RedBalloon-Version)?type=design&node-id=237-4234&t=z5OCte3k3yIQ7DVS-0)

**Details:**

* The items that will be in the Sort By dropdown:
  * Relevance
    * If the user selects this, then the `sort_by` param will *not* be sent in on the TypeSense request
  * Last Login
    * If the user selects this, then we'll send in `sort_by: 'last_login:desc'` in the TypeSense request
  * Location
    * If the user selects this, then we'll send in `sort_by: _geo(46.7323875,-117.0001651):asc`in the TypeSense request, where the numbers are the longitude and latitude of the location that was searched
* The Sort By Dropdown will *not* be enabled to sort by Location if:
  * They select "Remote" in the Filters modal
  * They do not have a location inputted in the location search
* Disable Location sort by w/ a tooltip (Search "No Location tooltip" in the Figma mock above)

**Tests:**

Verify that changing the sort by dropdown changes out cards

**Deliverables:**

Sort By Dropdown works and is tested
title: Sort by dropdown

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We are allowing *all* employers to click into and even search locked profiles. However, when they try unlocking a profile, there's lots of possible things that could happen that would prevent them from unlocking a profile. These include:

1. No more credits available
2. The employer does not have a package (or has the `no-plan` package)
3. The employer does not have valid payment information

If any of these are the case, we should handle these correctly and guide the employer to be able to make a purchase.

### **Latest Mock:**

Sections to take note on:

* "Purchase Credits - No Package" section for when there's no package for the user

[https://www.figma.com/file/rDaiHVSQ9PvcGN06nAQxCM/RedBalloon---Profile-Search-(RedBalloon-Version)?type=design&node-id=237-4234&t=z5OCte3k3yIQ7DVS-0](https://www.figma.com/file/rDaiHVSQ9PvcGN06nAQxCM/RedBalloon---Profile-Search-(RedBalloon-Version)?type=design&node-id=237-4234&t=z5OCte3k3yIQ7DVS-0)

**Details:**

* Follow this flow: [https://miro.com/app/board/uXjVMC7aE2o=/#tpicker-content](https://miro.com/app/board/uXjVMC7aE2o=/#tpicker-content)
* Get the employer's current payment info by making a call to `/employer/payment-settings` and checking for `{ "account_exists": false }`
* Get the employer's current package make a call to `/company/{company_id}/packages`. If the length is `0` or the only plan they have is `no-plan` then the employer does *not* have a package, and needs to purchase a package.
* Get the amount of credits the employer has by making a call to `/company/{company_id}/credits`
* Note that when the user clicks "Buy more" you don't need to check if they have credits, you only need to check if they have a plan/package. (see miro diagram above)

**Tests:**

API unit tests and new methods added to `CompanyApi` for the `GET /employer/payment-settings` endpoint

~React Integration Test that tests the following cases:~

* ~Unlock profile click~
  * ~Valid case~
  * ~Needs credits case~
  * ~Needs payment info cased~
  * ~Needs package case~
* ~Buy more credits click~
  * ~Valid case~
  * ~Needs payment info case~ 
  * ~Needs package case~

**Deliverables:**

* Handle when employers try to unlock a profile or buy more credits but they don't have all the prerequisites in place to do so.
title: Handle profile unlocks/purchase credits w/ invalid states

description:
### **Background/Summary:**

Employers want to be able to see how active the job seekers are, and avoid job seekers that haven't been on redballoon in months. This slider lets employers "filter out" job seekers that aren't that active.

### Latest Mock

[https://www.figma.com/file/rDaiHVSQ9PvcGN06nAQxCM/RedBalloon---Profile-Search-(RedBalloon-Version)?type=design&node-id=237-4234&t=z5OCte3k3yIQ7DVS-0](https://www.figma.com/file/rDaiHVSQ9PvcGN06nAQxCM/RedBalloon---Profile-Search-(RedBalloon-Version)?type=design&node-id=237-4234&t=z5OCte3k3yIQ7DVS-0)

### **Details:**

* Slider should click into place on each of the ticks
* Last Login Slider:
  * 30 days, 90 days, 180 days, 365 days, Any Time
  * Update reducer via an onchange when the slider is updated
  * Consume the reducer context created in the filter modal issue (RB-410)
* In the TypeSense API to send in a `last_login` filter, you add `last_login:>=1654034708` into the `filter_by` query. You have to convert "30 days" ago into a date and then figure out the unix epoch timestamp and send that in.
* Note that when the slider is set to "Any Time", the TypeSense `filter_by` param will *not* contain anything related to last login.

### **Tests:**

* Integration test that verifies context state is updated when the slider is dragged. Take a look at [this link](https://testing-library.com/docs/example-drag/) for more info on how to do that.

**Deliverables:**

* Build an in-house slider for the filter modal
* Hook up the new filters to the useReducer that builds the query to send it to the backend
title: Filter Modal - Last Login Slider

description:
**Background/Summary:**

The user needs a quick way to search for profiles. 

### Latest Mock

[https://www.figma.com/file/rDaiHVSQ9PvcGN06nAQxCM/RedBalloon---Profile-Search-(RedBalloon-Version)?type=design&node-id=237-4234&t=z5OCte3k3yIQ7DVS-0](https://www.figma.com/file/rDaiHVSQ9PvcGN06nAQxCM/RedBalloon---Profile-Search-(RedBalloon-Version)?type=design&node-id=237-4234&t=z5OCte3k3yIQ7DVS-0)

**Details:**

Pass the search text to search every field at the same time.

Include location search input, just like the way it is for job postings. 

Search for the seeker ids via key-up so we have it, then search by hitting the backend API when the user clicks the Search button

Put input into a form so the user can search via `Enter` key

Be sure to handle no results too

The fields to send in for the `query_by` param are:

* skills
* experience
* accomplishments
* education
* resume_text_redacted

Send in the following for `include_fields`: `id, skills, experience, accomplishments, education, resume_text_redacted`

Note you should send in those params in that exact order, because we want to weigh skills and experience more than resume_text_redacted. Resume text is kind of a "catch all" for anything that didn't previously match any of the other fields.

Also note that you ALWAYS send in `query_by` for all 5 of these properties, we always search them and don't give the user a choice.

*Note: This includes adding the reducer to the page*

**Tests:**

* Integration test to type something, click search, and verify cards change
* API Unit Tests for the Backend API endpoints

**Deliverables:**

Search bar w/ location search
title: Profile Search Bar

**Background/Summary:** Right now, we have two types of error messages with `useForm`. Error messages that show in the label, and error messages that show out of the label. We want the former. **Details:** So, change inputs like this: ``` {errors.ccFirstName && (
{errors.ccFirstName.message}
)} ``` To: ``` ``` Also, to help with ts, whenever we use yup or normal react-hook-form validation and send in a component (like below), ``` const purchaseFormSchema = yup.object({ ach: yup.bool(), ccFirstName: yup.string().when('ach', { is: false, then: yup .string() .required(First name is required), otherwise: yup.string(), }), }) ``` we want to change to just a normal string with a `() =>`, no components just the string (like below) ``` const purchaseFormSchema = yup.object({ ach: yup.bool(), ccFirstName: yup.string().when('ach', { is: false, then: yup .string() .required(() => 'First name is required'), otherwise: yup.string(), }), }) ``` Although it would be good to change all of the files you change to `.tsx`, feel free to hold on that for now.
title: Standardize Error Messages

**Background/Summary:**

The user will either get credits via their package *or* manually buying some credits. For frontend, we have to handle when the user wants to manually buy more credits. 

### **Latest Mock:**

[https://www.figma.com/file/rDaiHVSQ9PvcGN06nAQxCM/RedBalloon---Profile-Search-(RedBalloon-Version)?type=design&node-id=237-4234&t=z5OCte3k3yIQ7DVS-0](https://www.figma.com/file/rDaiHVSQ9PvcGN06nAQxCM/RedBalloon---Profile-Search-(RedBalloon-Version)?type=design&node-id=237-4234&t=z5OCte3k3yIQ7DVS-0)

**Details:**

Here's the pricing options, (you should pull these from `/credits/addons`)

**Assume the user already has payment information!**

Here's what the response will be like:

```
[¬†¬†{¬†¬†¬†¬†"type": "profile",¬†¬†¬†¬†"name": "string",¬†¬†¬†¬†"code": "string",¬†¬†¬†¬†"count": 0,¬†¬†¬†¬†"base_price": 0,¬†¬†¬†¬†"discount_price": 0 }
]
```

* 5 Credits: $50
* 20 Credits: ~$200~¬†$125
* 100 Credits: ~$1000~¬†$450

Endpoints to pay attention to:

* `/company/{company_id}/credits`
* `/company/{company_id}/credits/purchase`

After purchasing, there should be a SICK animation with the coins to signify they unlocked new credits. Use this as inspiration: [https://media.giphy.com/media/5DmivkdohxCRxeDAVL/giphy.gif](https://media.giphy.com/media/5DmivkdohxCRxeDAVL/giphy.gif)

**Tests:**

* API unit tests for frontend for the new endpoints we're hitting

**Deliverables:**

* Purchase credits modal
* Coin animation
title: Purchase Credits Modal

**Background/Summary:**

To make it easier to track for Aaron. Basically, what we want is an easy way for us to know that users are appearing on `/employer/payment` right after they finish registration.

**Details:**

To accomplish this, we need to update `getPaymentUrl()` to be able to conditionally add `finished_registration=true` to the url if the current page has `finished_registration=true`. 

I think honestly the simplest way to do this is to add `query` into `AppContext` provider, and then access that in the `usePurchaseNowPackages()` hook, and then conditionally add it in.

**Tests:**

`getButton()` should be abstracted into `getButtonType()` and `getButtonJsx()`. We should unit test the `getButtonType()`function to make sure the correct button appears, and the `getPaymentUrl()` function. 

Be sure to include the case where it‚Äôs a custom plan getting downgraded to ground crew or no plan

**Deliverables:**

* [ ] Handle `finished_registration=true` to the purchase now page buttons so it appears on the `/employer/payment` page
* [ ] Unit tests for `getButton()`
title: Add finished_registration=true to purchase buttons

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We added the hot new Entrepreneur card on our pricing page. Right now the logic for having it be showing is if all the following are true: (1) the user is an employer user, (2) the employer user registered on or after May 5, 2023 and (3) the employer user is on the `/purchase-now` page.

We need to add one more condition, where the employer user must *not* have any existing package already purchased. We don't want to show the new Entrepreneur card if they already have a package that's *not* Entrepreneur. (We still want to show the Entrepreneur card if they purchased Entrepreneur)

**Details:**

We decide what packages to show via the `getPackagesToShow()` function. This function needs to get updated to handle 

**Tests:**

* Modify `getPackagesToShow()` unit test to account for added logic:
  * If user is employer user with no packages, the returned packages should include Entrepreneur
  * If user is employer user with existing Standard package, then returned packages should NOT include Entrepreneur
  * If user is employer user that has already purchased Entrepreneur, then returned packages should include Entrepreneur (it'd be weird if the user bought Entrepreneur and then couldn't cancel the package lol)

**Deliverables:**

* [ ] Entrepreneur card is only shown to employer users without a package that registered May 5, 2023 or later.
* [ ] `getPackagesToShow()` unit test is updated to reflect new logic
title: Do not show Entrepreneur card to employers with existing package

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We are building the new profile employer search and we need a clean UI/UX experience for employers to filter down their search.

### Latest Mock

[https://www.figma.com/file/rDaiHVSQ9PvcGN06nAQxCM/RedBalloon---Profile-Search-(RedBalloon-Version)?type=design&node-id=237-4234&t=z5OCte3k3yIQ7DVS-0](https://www.figma.com/file/rDaiHVSQ9PvcGN06nAQxCM/RedBalloon---Profile-Search-(RedBalloon-Version)?type=design&node-id=237-4234&t=z5OCte3k3yIQ7DVS-0)

**Details:**

This modal has some complexity to it:

* We will want to build a reducer that contains a function for updating each of the filters
* This Reducer will not exist in the modal. It would be at the top of the profile search components and will be consumed in context. The modal will then consume the context to update the state at the top
* In the bottom right, there is a button that shows how many profiles you have filtered down to
  * This will be live typesense fetching every time you change a filter in the modal
* The TypeSense endpoint wrapper and backend API to fetch profile info from the seeker ids will be created in this issue: [RB-382](https://linear.app/redballoon/issue/RB-382/typesense-backend-api-search)
* Use `useTransition()` with Suspense for the button in the bottom right. 
* You can get the total number of results by checking the `found` property that comes back from a TypeSense request 

**Tests:**

Test to make sure the reducer state correctly updates when the functions to update state are fired

**Deliverables:**

* Create the modal template
* Build the useReducer with the context at the top level
* Consume the reducer via context in the modal
* Create the "Clear All" and "Show 143 Profiles" button and the `x` button in the top right
title: Filter Modal - Create the modal and Search Bar

**Background/Summary:**

When we were testing out the pricing page, Jacob found an edge case where employers that have websites that don't include `https` in the beginning. He was trying out `RedBalloon LLC` 

**Details:**

(1) Change the payment page to just always show the Account Details, even if the user already has first name and last name and website filled out. It's just more clear and we've had like 2 different times when the form wouldn't submit because of the account details which the user can't see

(2) Remove the requirement for the user to *have* to type `https://` at the beginning of their url, because it's super annoying for users to type. So we'll accept the website if `https://` is there, `http://` is there, or if it's missing.

**Deliverables:**

* [ ] Purchases work for existing Employer Users that have websites that do *not* include `https`
* [ ] Website input on payment page accepts websites that do *not* include `https`
* [ ] Account Details section is always showing
title: Handle Employer Payments Page Edge Case

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Being able to suggest a salary range for a job postings is a very difficult task, one that the folks over at Emsi BurningCast Benefits have been working on for years with a few large engineering teams.  

However, we hope to come up with something that is good enough to give directional, actionable information to employers about their hiring market context.

We have a plan for LMI data that may meet these objectives, but we want to run a test to see how well it actually works.

**Details:**

For 5 existing job postings:

* [X] Compare the job title to ONET to see what normalized title the employer would be likely to choose (if any!) and which ONET(s) would be associated with that title.
* [X] From that title, find corresponding SOC data (regional, state, national) and put the ranges alongside each other.
* [X] Write a brief analysis of how well the model works, and what could be done better (1) automatically or (2) by humans.

**Tests:**

It may be helpful to have a non-LMI familiar person choose the normalized job title

**Follow-up:**

Compile and communicate the reports to Aaron so he can take it to an exec meeting.

**Deliverables:**

Experiment with the viability of our job title and salary suggestion idea.

[LMI Overview.odt](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/4aed762f-4198-44c8-bfea-93f02a87e0b0/1aab375e-605d-47b2-8cd3-566f6d443167)

We want to be able to delete applicants so that they never show up in the applicants table for a particular employer.

**Details:**

Instead of deleting the application, which would ruin our metrics, we want to archive the application. 

* Alter the applications column to add an `archived_at` timestamp
* Add an endpoint that updates the `archived_at` field
* Everywhere we GET applicants, only return rows where the `archived_at` field is null
  * Don't do this on the endpoints where we are gathering metrics; only where we return the application info

**Tests:**

* Check that an archived applicant does not show up in GET endpoints
* Check that archived applicant does not change metrics

**Follow-up:**

Let Isaac know that you are done.

**Background/Summary:**

Honeybadger.setContext() should be used for globally setting the context so that any future or concurrent notifications also have that context. If you just need context to be filled in for a particular error message, set the context within the call to notify as shown in this MR.

**Details:**

In each case, review the usage and determine if we meant to set the global context, or simply set the context for the following HB notification. If the latter, change the code to specify the context directly inside the call to \`notify()\`.

**Tests:**

Whatever the frontend team does ‚Äî this doesn't warrant a test in ~my~ Stephen's book.

**Follow-up:**

None.

**Deliverables:**

Remove possibility of accidental context setting in HB
title: Honeybadger setContext

description:
**Background/Summary:**

We shipped the new employer registration but a couple of things happened: 

1. Danny was concerned that his largest sales lead generation (phone numbers via employer registrations) was going to disappear.
2. The website field, which has been used by Jacob to vet new employers and approve them, is now not required so there's not really a good way to vet new employers. 

**Details:**

We have to add back in the Phone Number input into step 1, and the website field into the "Account Details" section of the payment page, right underneath the first and last name field, and needs to be required.

Not only that, based on what the user types into the account details first name and last name, it should automatically fill in the name in the payment details section if it's empty. It shouldn't override it if there's something already typed in. Also it shouldn't go the other way, aka changes to the name in the payment details section changes the account details name.

**Tests:**

* React Integration Test that tests typing in name in the account details section, and observing the name is copied over into the payment details section

**Deliverables:**

* [ ] Phone number input required and added to Step 1 of registration
* [ ] Website field required and added to payment page when purchasing a package
* [ ] Auto-copy name into payment details from account details
title: Employer Registration Hotfixes

description:
**Background/Summary:**

Currently, it is difficult for the CS team to comb through the Metabase at-risk report and find the corresponding customer in HubSpot. To improve CS efficiency, we want to flag customers as at-risk directly in HubSpot.

**Details:**

Create a daily job that changes the Lifecycle Stage of Companies to ‚ÄúCustomer ‚Äì At Risk‚Äù when:

* They are on a paid plan **AND**
* They have not cancelled the current plan (regardless of whether their plan is expired) **AND**
* Subscription is > 7 days ago **AND**
* JOBS POSTED = 0 **OR** TOTAL APPLICATIONS FOR COMPANY <= 5

We also need to consider moving customer off of this lifecycle:

* Customers are already marked as canceled, so we don't need to do anything for that case
* We do not need to update on posted jobs because they will still have apps <= 5
* We need to update the lifecycle stage back to `Customer` if:
  * TOTAL APPLICATIONS FOR COMPANY > 5 **AND**
  * they have not canceled

**Tests:**

* Add tests for the following:
  * Not on paid plan
  * Plan is canceled
  * subscription date is <= 7 days
  * 0 job posting
  * Apps <= 5
  * sufficient conditions for at risk

**Follow-up:**

If tests exceed estimated LOE, write an issue to finish testing.

**Deliverables:**

At-risk companies flagged in CRM
title: CRM at-risk flag

**Background/Summary:**

Email templates and applicant messages need to be able to support personalization tokens. When an applicant message is being sent, we need to parse the subject and message body to replace any tokens with the appropriate value.

**Details:**

Add a parsing function to replace personalization tokens:

* `{first name}`, `{last name}`, `{job title}`, and `{business name}`
* the `application_id` is passed into this function, so you will have all the details needed for these tokens

Modify `addApplicantMessage()` in `employers.ts` to call the parsing function. Replace tokens in the subject and the body before sending the email.

**Tests:**

* Add a unit test for the parsing function
* Modify tests for applicant messages

**Deliverables:**

* Applicant messages support personalization tokens
title: Applicant message personalization tokens

**Background/Summary:**

We are adding the ability for an employer to create email templates to more quickly respond to job applicants. Templates will be company-wide, so we *do not* need to separate them by `team_id`. The email templates need to support personlization tokens `first_name`, `last_name`, `business_name`, and `job_title`.

**Details:**

Create `email_templates` migration file

```
id
company_id
display_order
name
subject
body
created_at
edited_at
```

`POST /company/{company_id}/template`

`PATCH /company/{company_id}/template/{template_id}`

`DELETE /company/{company_id}/template/{template_id}`

`GET /company/{company_id}/template/{template_id}`

`GET /company/{company_id}/templates`

* Response shape:

  `[{id: 1, name: 'Rejection', display_order: 1}, {id: 2, name: 'Interview Request', display_order: 2}]`

If the "auto-reply" named template doesn't exist for the company, add it with default values at the end.

**Tests:**

* Add test for each endpoint
title: Email templates endpoints

People are coming to the site, creating a checkbox/radio question but not adding an answer. This causes an error.

**Solution:**

However, a separate employer user with the id `14511` has the same ip.

This is not an employer made from the office, but one of our customers.

Look into why this may be happening.

There's also a chance that the `md5()` hash is different, but we're slicing off the part of the string that was different.

description:
### WHAT:

Our own RedBalloon people have found some inconviences with working with bulk amounts of employees in the applications table. Sometimes there are duplicate applications in the table, the table filters don't get cached and there is a lot of data so it takes a while to load each time. etc.

### ENGINEERING NOTES:

### DELIVERABLES:

* Build the functionality into the application table rows that clicking an Application Row opens the application in a new tab
* Add a delete column with a confirmation modal (use trash OR trash can, you decide and deal with the consequences)
* Make column header icons smaller
* Replace the Nation Region column with a State Region column
title: Applications Table Improvements

description:
Currently there is only a little security for our customers as we don't have a CSP. From looking around a bit, the best way to enable a CSP is to implement the `next-safe` package in the `next.config.js` file.

Steps are as follows:

1. `yarn add next-safe`
2. Add implementation to `next.config.js`
3. Open the site w/ console and start loosening the CSP rules till everything is happy. Make sure to think through all of the situations where we pull from other domains (e.g. youtube, hubspot, other subdomains, etc).

### Things to Test:

* YouTube videos can play
* Rumble videos can play 
* Vimeo videos can play
* HubSpot form submits can happen
* Plausible events still happen 
* Frontend API endpoints still work 
* Typesense calls still work 
* CSS is loaded from backblaze
* Uploads to backblaze
* CloudFlare Videos still work
* CC iFrame submissions
* Images from backblaze show up
* Next.js images still show up (like the loading spinner in `<Button />`)
* JS loads 
* Copy to clipboard still works on seeker profile

If it's doable, then actually do the issue and merge the MR. If there's a lot more work, then create follow-up issues.
title: Research Content-Security-Policy

description:
It'll say small business. 

Update buttons to have unique text on pricing page

Only show card for newly created businesses, and *not* ones that already exist. When the employer comes back to the pricing page if they registered before this issue, they should *not* see the new card. However if an employer comes back to the pricing page and registered *after* this issue ships, then we *do* show them the new card. 

Do NOT show the new entrepreneur card on `/employer-info`, only show it on `/purchase-now` for new employers.

The `/company/{company_id}` endpoint now returns `creation_datetime` , which we will use to compare if the employer has registered recently or not.

## Summary of things to Change:

1. Move `awareness` and `website` inputs to step 1
2. Keep step 2 as the pledge
3. Remove step 3 of registration
4. Remove all billing details on the employer payment page, but keep zip code, promo code, billing email and purchase order. The payment details on the left side and the zip code are the *only* required inputs still. 

After they buy something, then redirect them to the employer account details page where they can fill in the rest of their details and display the following changes, except instead of saying "Thanks for signing up!" say **"Thank you for your purchase!".** We can control whether this message shows up via a query param `initial_registration=true`

![employer-account-after-signup.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/2890b6a6-3226-4bb2-b8a2-d70b0b5cbde2/2f93f60d-1d94-4392-82b8-07e161f6c613)

* [X] ~If incomplete seeker account, but still have cookie, then redirect to step 2~ Due to the way we redirect the user back to the account details page, I think we're fine not worrying about this
