description:
## LATEST UPDATE (as of 4/26/23 @ 5pm )

From Tim Clark yesterday: 

Header: "Turley Talks Listeners" ¬†Subheader: "Enter your email to download this exclusive guide for optimizing your job postings."

## Description

For Turley Talks, we will be building a custom modal on the first step of employer registration that has a form that allows users to sign up for the free report. When they fill in their email, we will pre-populate their email in the first step of registration. The page will look for a special query param `turley=true`, and if present the page will say a special message.

We have to copy the backend guys for sending this email. Look specifically at the `sendEmail()` function in  `src/mail.ts` 

Add a redirect for `/turley` to redirect to `/create-employer-account?turley=true`

The download button should make a request to HubSpot's email api, and will email the user with an attachment to this pdf: [https://assets.redballoon.work/docs/Optimize+your+Job+Posting+Report+V6.pdf](https://assets.redballoon.work/docs/Optimize+your+Job+Posting+Report+V6.pdf)

![turley-modal.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/8542f981-ed53-42d8-97a4-4faf11946709/1cc33b3b-dc55-495e-8ff1-118f79b48fa8)

![modified-first-step.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/4198cf9d-1a86-457b-b27b-413d1f2f452f/b4b2af23-f064-4781-85e6-39602295dd56)
title: Create Turley modal

description:
Google search isn't indexing some of our pages, videos, job postings, etc because of problems. Here are some changes to fix the problem:

* PublicSq video needs a `description`. [https://www.redballoon.work/publicsq](https://www.redballoon.work/publicsq)
* Job postings are invalid because they don't have `hiringOrganization`. [https://developers.google.com/search/docs/appearance/structured-data/job-posting](https://developers.google.com/search/docs/appearance/structured-data/job-posting)

  Examples:
  * [https://www.redballoon.work/posting/928/remote-asp-net-developer](https://www.redballoon.work/posting/928/remote-asp-net-developer)
  * [https://www.redballoon.work/posting/6293/executive-vice-president-for-sales-growth?search_term=](https://www.redballoon.work/posting/6293/executive-vice-president-for-sales-growth?search_term=)
  * More can be provided
* Incorrect value type "@id"
  * [https://www.redballoon.work/posting/6293/executive-vice-president-for-sales-growth?search_term=](https://www.redballoon.work/posting/6293/executive-vice-president-for-sales-growth?search_term=)
  * [https://www.redballoon.work/posting/5077/security-specialist](https://www.redballoon.work/posting/5077/security-specialist)
  * More can be provided
* (Optional) Improve item appearance - See below
  * `validThrough` we don't care about this.
  * Ask for examples

Let Jonathan know as each are fixed so that he can mark them as fixed.

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/a118839e-9513-4dab-b4e9-0d1a26213c3c/e774db38-1947-4229-aacc-40bd7a2d93eb)

description:
We got bum advice from the Everflow rep regarding how to use their conversion webhook. We thought we could use a single endpoint to get the cookies necessary for using the webhook, but it turns out that there is a different endpoint for every affiliate. 

We are meeting soon with an Everflow rep to discuss the best way to handle this, but at the moment it looks like we need to store the affiliate-endpoint mapping in the db and do a look-up based on affiliate ID. If a better option exists, such as an API that takes affiliate ID and returns the endpoint, then we can use that.

* Add affiliate_id to endpiont mapping table to db
* Look up cookie endpoint based on affiliated ID to retrieve correct cookies

description:
We would like non-engineers to be able to write simple awareness rules that bucket certain variations on the awareness field together and display the output. We need to bucket both job seekers and employers.

* Use the following headers in a csv that defines the bucketing `term, source, channel` 
  * Example: `public sq, PublicSq, Social` , `psq, PublicSq, Social`, etc.
* The term match should be a Postgres ILIKE and contains: `ILIKE '%term%'`
* Output:
  * `id, type, source, channel`
    * where type is seeker or employer
  * Needs to retain null valued source and channel
title: Awareness bucketing

description:

* Write a script to loop through every customer who has a `purchases_export` purchase where the discount is greater than zero and update the `purchase_history` table with the correct amount
  * There is no invoice ID in the legacy purchase history data, so the script will need to compare customer and dates

description:
### WHAT:

We now have the ability to do integration tests and to start, we want to test the new ATS applicants table

### ENGINEERING NOTES:

* Gabe's awesome Integration testing MR: [https://github.com/GabeMeister/msw-next-js](https://github.com/GabeMeister/msw-next-js)
* Currently we need to modify our config files to be able to use the React testing library
  * `next.config.js`
  * `jest.config.js`
* We will need to create mock data for the endpoints that are used in the ATS table (We don't want to use live API requests for our integration tests)
  * `CompanyApi.applicants().get()`
  * `CompanyApi.applicantStatus().get()`
  * The mock data for these endpoints should be the same shape as it's superstruct structure
    * Can find these in `companyDataStructures.ts`
  * The mock data should also get added to our CompanyApi unit tests
  * So now you would have:

    ```
      it('applicants', async () => {
        const data = await company.applicants().get();
    
        assert(data, structs.Applicants);
        assert(mockedApplicantData, structs.Applicants);
      });
    ```
* We also want to avoid implementation details when writing these tests (basically test what the user sees and cares about)
  * A good way to know which elements to grab to avoid implementation details, is by plugging components into this site: [https://testing-playground.com/](https://testing-playground.com/)

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/aea6c787-4887-4e8c-baad-121e7c2e0299/b7dd62c9-7343-4f47-a7d4-c2a8572296af)

### DELIVERABLES:

* Test that the Applications table is populated correctly and that the columns and rows are what we expect
* Test that when you change the status dropdown, the table only shows rows that match that status
* Test that if the table is filtered by a posting, only rows associated with that posting show up in the table
* Test that if you are on say "Review" status, and switch the status of a specific row to say "Hired", that row gets removed from the table, but that it exists when you change the filter in the table header to "Hired"
title: Integration Tests for ATS Table

description:
![Screen Shot 2023-04-06 at 10.42.43 AM.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/cd4e4158-e491-4a31-ac7c-708e6607e3f9/3adc8bfa-88dc-4616-82c6-91c85b58a8f2)

It is indeed Affinda. Here is the response from their support.

Hi Kenny,¬†
The Resume seems to have Fonts with custom encoding, so it would be the raw text that has the spaces , the parsed value of the resume seems to have the location details correctly extracted .¬†
The Type and Encoding of a font used in a PDF file can cause issues when text is being extracted from the document.
In the case of Type 3 fonts, which are custom fonts, text extraction can be more difficult because the characters in the font may not be represented in a standard way that text extraction tools can recognize. Type 3 fonts may also include custom glyphs that are not present in standard fonts, making it difficult to correctly recognize and translate the text.
Similarly, with custom encoding, the characters in the font are mapped to unique codes within the PDF file. This can make it difficult to correctly recognize and translate the characters, especially if the encoding is not recognized by the tool.
we are investigating this internally as well and will keep you updated.¬†
title: Affinda whitespace bug

description:
Every time the frontend deploys, there is a period of time where nginx will reply to requests, but nextjs isn't ready. This causes nginx to respond with 502s.

There is also a problem with 404s being returned when there is a new deployment because next creates immutable deployments and therefore has unique file names for static files. When there is a new deployment, the old static files no longer exist and the clients get 404s until they reload their page.

Potential solutions for 404s:

* Add last releases static files to this release so that the previous releases' pages are available.
* Serve static files through nginx and cut nextjs out. (Should be faster and produce fewer 502s)
* It would also be possible to add another upstream server as backup in the nginx config till nextjs is up and running. The only problem here is that health checks would always return happy.
title: Investigate 502s and 404s on frontend deployments

description:
## Summary

We have to get deeper metrics on user behavior. We're going to do this by sending in Plausible events for various events that happen in the tool.

## What to do

Make a React hook that handles generating/retrieving all the metrics found in the "Columns" sheet here:

[https://redballoonllc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/all/\_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc={07DA4162-A431-492C-8A54-3062851DBC97}&file=L1 L2 Conversions - Jan 2023.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true&cid=0e47e391-4d28-49f9-9e7f-4315c4052dda](https://redballoonllc.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/all/\_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7B07DA4162-A431-492C-8A54-3062851DBC97%7D&file=L1%20L2%20Conversions%20-%20Jan%202023.xlsx&action=default&mobileredirect=true&cid=0e47e391-4d28-49f9-9e7f-4315c4052dda)

The hook should have easy function calls to either track events for unknown users, seekers, or employers. 

~Also do any events with the~ `~Unknown~` ~user type in the spreadsheet.~ After this, we'll be tracking literally **EVERYTHING** 

## Engineering Notes

* The new hook should utilize `src/hooks/useEventAnalytics.js`. 
* Metadata will be sent in as extra props in the `recordEvent()` call.

Be sure to hash the ip by using `md5()`.

Potentially put in class names so things are done automatically when buttons are clicked? [https://plausible.io/docs/custom-event-goals#2-add-a-css-class-name-to-the-element-you-want-to-track-on-your-site](https://plausible.io/docs/custom-event-goals#2-add-a-css-class-name-to-the-element-you-want-to-track-on-your-site)
title: Create Analytics React Hook w/ Unknown user events

description:
Make a call to `/company/{company_id}/lifecycle` when either of the following happens:

1. The employer user browses to the `/employer/payment` page, and they're NOT already a customer.
2. The employer user browses to the `/purchase-now` page NOT after registration. Check for a`finished_registration=true` flag in the query param to verify they are coming to the page right after they finish registration. If the query param is there, then don't send in this SQL. 

   Also, use `GET /company/{company_id}/lifecycle` to figure out what stage the employer actually is on, and *only* send in this call when they are in the `MQL` stage.

The *only* time frontend sends in a call to change the lifecycle stage is when the customer is *currently* MQL, or Cancelled Customer.

For context, all the possible states the customer can be in on HubSpot:

* MQL
* SQL
* Customer
* At-risk Customer
* Cancelled Customer

Here's the enum that backend guys use:

```
export enum LifeCycleStage {
¬†¬†¬† InitStage = 'marketingqualifiedlead',
¬†¬†¬† MQL = 'marketingqualifiedlead',
¬†¬†¬† SQL = 'salesqualifiedlead',
¬†¬†¬† Customer = 'customer',
¬†¬†¬† CancelationMQL = '65266105', // Custom stages are numeric
}
```

### Tests

* React Integration tests needed:
  * Verify a request is sent to `/company/{company_id}/lifecycle` when the employer visits `/employer/payment` and is in the MQL stage
  * Verify a request is sent to `/company/{company_id}/lifecycle` when the employer visits `/employer/payment` and is in the Cancelled stage
  * Verify that NO request is sent to `/company/{company_id}/lifecycle` when the employer visits `/employer/payment` and is already in the SQL stage
  * Verify a request is sent to `/company/{company_id}/lifecycle` when the employer visits `/employer/purchase-now` and there is no `finished_registration=true` query param
  * Verify that NO request is sent to `/company/{company_id}/lifecycle` when the employer visits `/employer/purchase-now` and there IS a `finished_registration=true` query param
title: HubSpot LifeCycle Call

description:
**Background**

For the profile search feature, when an employer wants access to a full profile/resume they will consume credits. We need to implement a backend endpoint to handle the creating, checking, and consuming of credits.

The overall credit system will work as follow:

* X credits need to be assigned when certain plans are purchase. 
  * For example, when a customer purchases Standard, five search credits are added to the customer
* X credits are add during each renewal
* Credits must roll over to the next billing period.
  * For example, a customer starts with five credits and uses two in the first month. When their package renews, they will get five more for a total of eight credits.
* When the employer accesses a particular profile/resume after a search, it will consume a single credit

**Details**

* Add a database table to log credit events
* Add a database table (or column) to track remaining credits
* Make all endpoints generic and require type of credit (e.g., profile, posting) in the path or body

  Add a `POST /company/{company_id}/credits/purchase` endpoint to purchase new credits
  * Use an add-on to charge for additional credits
  * Which add-on needs to depend on the existing subscription (plan)
* Add a `POST /company/{company_id}/credits/consume` endpoint to consume a credit
  * Decrement credit count
  * Return remaining credits


* Add `GET /company/{company_id}/credits` endpoint
  * Returns the number of remaining profile credits
  * Returns the cost of purchasing more credits, based on the customers existing plan
title: Resume credit endpoints

description:
## Summary

When seekers come from linkedin, we *really* want to scare them away if they're not values aligned, instead of having them come to RedBalloon, register, and *then* figure out they're not values aligned. This only applies to postings that we put on Linkedin. Here's what the page is supposed to look like:

![linkedin-landing-page.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/9eb7edba-cd09-4ae9-9ef2-dab2fc163abb/86232b5f-a3a1-4698-949e-3da3c59b453c)

## Engineering Notes

* The link that seekers click will be `https://redballoon.work/linkedin-registration/<posting_id>`. 
* The content be like the normal `/create-seeker-account` page, except for the following differences:
  * Alternate heading content. This includes the posting title and company name which need to be pulled via server side props (hitting the `/posting/<posting_id>` endpoint)
  * The dark blue background is swapped out for the American flag background image
  * The background needs to have a blue gradient that appears towards the bottom. Should probably make a `<GradientBackground />` component that we can re-use.
  * The same video on the homepage appears next to the create account form
* At the end of registration, we strip out all the content and only say "Registration Complete!" and then the button says "Continue to Application".
  * To determine what content to show on the `/new-seeker-signup` page, we should check the cookies for a `linkedin=true` in `req.headers.cookie`. We initially set the cookie on initial page load in `/linkedin-registration`.

### Photo to use:

![american-flag.png](https://uploads.linear.app/caeca637-e3d0-4bb3-bb0b-9cd7a2a19c44/c37a0825-1111-4394-a573-0868e8152431/8efea8d3-fa82-4fee-b003-f41a83c14f07)
title: Make LinkedIn Landing Page

description:
Write a Metabase query to track when customers update their CC information.

Originated from an email from Jacob:

> Hi Team,
>
> We are running into some workflow and customer experience issues with failed/declined CC info. It would be really helpful for CS/me to have a log or update whenever a customer updates their payment info in RB. This would let us know and allow us to resend for collection without having to call them (or manually checking transactions against their current payment info).¬†In a future, beautiful world, it would be awesome if, when a customer updates their payment info in RB, it triggers Lago to retry their failed invoices. I know it will take us some time to get to that, but even having a log of changes in a table in the meantime would be hugely helpful for us.¬†
title: Track CC updates in Metabase

description:

* Retrieve the `business_name` from the `company_details` table
* Add `company: business_name`  to the `info` variable that gets passed to RP:

  ```
  const options = {
          headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded' },
          method: 'POST',
          body: new URLSearchParams(info),
      };
  ```
  * Possible variables for the RP transaction are listed in the docs [here](https://secure.reverepayments.com/merchants/resources/integration/integration_portal.php#transaction_variables)
* `info` is not currently typed; fix that!!!
title: Add company name to RP customer vault

The changes for this will happen in the backend issue, but because applications are going to a new page, we need to update some frontend code too.

description:
Lago's normal upgrade behavior is confusing when a customer upgrades from a Ground Crew $0 package to any other paying package. The upgrade causes the customer to be billed a prorated amount until the next customer billing anniversary.

Example:

Customer signed up on the Jan 6, 2023, for Ground Crew. On Mar 3 they upgrade to Standard. They will be billed \~$26 for the 3 days remaining until the billing anniversary on the 6th, when they will be billed the full $245.

* When a customer pays for a new package, check to see if they are on ground-crew. If they are, first terminate the ground crew package before adding the new purchase.
title: Terminate Ground Crew before upgrade

description:
The problem to solve is when a seeker types something new in the job title search, but DOESN'T hit search, and then clicks "Save as Job Alert", the job alert actually doesn't save anything, because the job alert modal looks directly at the URL for all the search params to save. 

The solution is to do a job search just before the modal comes up to save your job alert. When the user completes the form, THEN it will look at the updated URL query params and correctly save what they searched for.
title: Do job search on "Save as Job Alert" click

title: Add coupon to sales-initiated invoice magic link

description:
Out current backup strategy is: suck data from live to ballooner and then `pg_dump` ballooner to B2. The problem with this is that not all tables are being dumped to ballooner and we have to change schema names so that all of the tables can live concurrently on the data lake.

There are two pieces to this issue:

1. `pg_dump` rb-db in a datapulls CI job and push the gzip'd result to B2 bucket `redballoon-backup`.
2. Move the backup of ballooner's postgresql instance and clickhouse instance from Jonathan's crontab to CI job(s).
title: Better DB Backups

description:
On the old app site, we logged a user's hashed IP, user ID, type of user, etc in the pageview events. We have neglected to implement that on the new site.

So that we are not generating 2 events for every page load, we should turn on manual pageviews and follow the information found here: [https://plausible.io/docs/script-extensions#scriptmanualjs](https://plausible.io/docs/script-extensions#scriptmanualjs)

If possible, we should include the event props at the top level of the app so that we don't have to request the data more than once. What would be even better would be to use something like server side props to define the information for the client instead of forcing the client to request the data as a second request.

## Engineering Notes

* Before, we made a request to `pages/api/user-data/index.js` in the `rewrite-frontend` repo. We called that endpoint in `pages/_app.js`. Instead of doing it this way, we should return `ip` via the `getServerSideProps()` and save us from making so many requests 
* Add `manual="true"` the `pages/_app.js` file. This changes from Plausible's automatic page view tracking to manual, which we can include additional data with.
* Event must be `pageview`
title: Enable manual pageview events

**1. Mission Statement**

Hollywood 4 Freedom is an organization of entertainment industry professionals unwilling to compromise our individual liberties and collectively driven, by our divine purpose, to create a new Hollywood.

Hollywood 4 Freedom utilizes a professional industry database to bridge together artists, crew members and content creators, to production companies, investors and distributors committed to supporting traditional American values, rights and freedoms.

To accomplish this mission, we aim to make use of various forms of entertainment and media outlets, including but not limited to productions, educational seminars, professional development workshops, skilled trainings, special events and fundraisers.

**2. Core Values -**¬†

**FREEDOM**¬†‚Äì We are committed to standing up for American freedoms and constitutional rights within the entertainment industry.

**TRUTH**¬†‚Äì We are advocates for truth, founded upon our faith and an unshakeable biblical perspective.

**COMMUNITY**¬†‚Äì We are building a community of Hollywood free thinkers committed to creating and producing content that is free of woke propaganda.¬†¬†

description:
This partner page will be like NRB's page, which is the Employer w/ Options page (#2 in the mock) 

 1. **Mission Statement**
    1. IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR VETERANS WHO HAVE SACRIFICED THE MOST.
 2. **Core Values**
    1. Veterans are not a budget item, a liability, or an expense. They are the main thread by which our society, in all its diversity and dynamics, is held together, supported, and sustained.
    2. Without supporting those who have sacrificed the most for our country, the sustainment of the force, and by relationship, the future force, is in jeopardy.
    3. A knowledgeable network and adequate resources are necessary for the better outcomes America owes its Veterans.
    4. High-performing Veterans have the potential to be the most high-contributing members of society.
 3. **Marketing Video**

    [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dmUuIatg7dA](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dmUuIatg7dA)

description:
Add `applicant_status` table to DB

* application_id, status, lasted_changed_by (employer user id), created_at, edited_at
* Possible applicant statuses:
  * New Applicant
  * Review
  * Interview - Phone Screen
  * Interview - Hiring Manager
  * Interview - Team Members
  * Interview - Executive
  * Offer Pending
  * Hired
  * Not a Fit for This Position
  * Not a Fit for Our Company

Add `applicant_status_log` table to DB:

* application_id, employer_user, old_status, new_status, created_at, updated_at

Add PUT `/company/{company_id}/applicant-status` endpoint:

* Shape of request body: { application_id, employer_user, status }

Add GET `/company/{company_id}/applicant-status` endpoint:

* Query params: `application_id`
* Return: { status, last_changed_by, updated_at }
* If there is no applicant status row, but the `application_id` is valid, then return 404
* A null employer_user id means the status is in its initial state

Modify `/seeker/{seeker_id}/application` endpoint to add an applicant status to the `applicant-status` table

Add `status` to results from GET `/company/{company_id}/applicants`

Write SQL query to seed the `applicant_status` table with the initial applicant status for all applications

Release steps:

After deploying to prod, seed the `applicant_status` table with applicants
title: Create applicant status endpoints

description:
The `/postings/{posting_id}` endpoint needs to be accessible by job seekers, so we cannot lock down the endpoint to just the company; however, there is information, such as `assigned_to` that job seekers do not need access to. Remove non-public information from the endpoint and create a new endpoint, if necessary, that provides the private information but is limited to the company who owns the posting.

Be sure to communicate with frontend team before shipping this change.
title: Shore up vulnerabilities in the /postings/{posting_id} endpoint

description:
We need to periodically change the Typesense API key, so that users can't use an API key for searching resumes, even after they are no longer paying.

Use scoped api keys to not allow users who aren't operators to view PII. Currently only operators have access to resume search, but in the future we will be allowing employers to do so as well.

* [ ] Generating scoped api keys (operators should still have full access, employers should not be able to see things like name, address, etc‚Ä¶)
* [ ] Script/CI job to rotate those keys frequently in order to keep endpoints fresh
title: Rotate Typesense Keys

description:
Utilizes the magic links feature that `/api/auto-payment` does.

Hide the buttons. 

The page should live at `/employer/forwarded-application/9578?lock=f2eef28f76ef672e887ef`. The lock query param should be "unsealed" similar to the way it's done in `pages/api/auto-payment/index.js`. 

The data that lives in the unsealed `lock` param is: 

```
{¬† application_id: 5234, company_id:10999 }
```

You should be able to pull all the seeker/application details all from the application id.
title: Add new read-only applicant page

description:
Currently, employers have no means of sharing an applicant profile with someone who does not have an employer user account on the website. We want to add the ability for an employer to forward an applicant profile.

* Create an endpoint to forward an applicant profile to non-account holders
* The endpoint should generate a magic link that allows anyone with the link to access the applicant profile
  * The magic link should expire after 14 days
  * The magic link should only grant access to that specific profile; it should not grant any employer user access or features
* Information to track in the db:
  * Who forwarded the applicant
  * When was it forwarded
  * Which seeker's application was forwarded
* Coordinate with Alex on email template
* Look at where the backend API calls `/api/autopayment` in the frontend API for a clue no how to do this
* Remember to CC the forwarder. "Name" via RedBalloon <info@redballoon.work>

Email template:

Subject: Application for <job title>: <applicant name>

Hi \[ <first_name> | there\],

¬†<Sender Name> forwarded you an application to <job title>. Check it out below!
title: Applicant Forwarding

description:
The employer dashboard display of application metrics is confusing because we are showing evenly spaced datapoints that are not necessarily evenly spaced in time. To improve the endpoint we need to:

* Return all dates, regardless of applications
* Trim the start date, but do not trim the end date (i.e., return all dates up to the requested end date, even if there are zero applicants
* `/company/{company_id}/application-metrics`
title: Improve GET applications endpoint

description:
## Button Mock

 [https://www.figma.com/file/saNQkQadd21mz31arAyTxg/Web-Design?node-id=47-331&t=zGNCE8XRD1CvcLnY-0](https://www.figma.com/file/saNQkQadd21mz31arAyTxg/Web-Design?node-id=47-331&t=zGNCE8XRD1CvcLnY-0)

## What To Do

Make the `<Button />` component be the contents of  `<HomepageButton />` everywhere.

Replace everywhere we have `<HomepageButton />` with `<Button />`.

Fully eradicate `<HomepageButton />` from our codebase. 

IMPORTANT: change order of buttons on Create/Edit posting page to have "Publish" as the first, primary button, and "Save" as the one to the right of it, and have that be a secondary button. Lots of confusion from our employers.

## Scope

Number of places that have `<Button />`: 94 instances across 57 files. 

Number of places that have `<HomepageButton />`: 16 instances across 8 files.
title: <Button />

description:
Put the script in `data-pulls`. Make the script work like this:

```
# Copy live database into QA database
./scripts/copydb live qa

# Copy QA database into local database
./scripts/copydb qa local
```

* [X] The script should throw an exception if you attempt to copy something into live.
* [X] Set up a scheduled CI job to copy live to qa every weekend
* [X] Script should be able to be run on demand as well as automatically.
* [ ] ~Add a step to the~ `rb-docker:run.bash` ~to seed the db with qa data.~
title: Make DB refresh script

description:
We will use [Affinda](https://api.affinda.com/docs#overview) to parse all uploaded resumes. The front-end will continue to upload resumes to Backblaze from the browser; however, we need to update the seeker attachment endpoint to parse resumes.

* Modify `/seeker/{seeker_id}/attachment` endpoint to parse resumes with Affinda
* Consider updating attachment table (or add a new table, if that is better) to keep track of Affinda ID; Affinda stores parsed info for later access (do we need this?)
* Add parsed resume table in the DB (use the Affinda API to determine the shape of the table)
* Insert parsed elements into DB
title: Integrate Affinda
